scenes.location: U.S. SMALL BUSINESS ADMIN. SUPPLY ROOM
characters: WHY DOESN'T THIS SHIT MAKE YOU AS
WERE YOU PLANNING TO TELL ME
I WON'T HAVE THIS SCREWED UP.

dialogues.speaker: ON TWO FBI AGENTS
dialogues.text: TOM SHAW and DAN BENNET, seated on the edge of a coffee table in this RURAL APARTMENT, uncomfortably close TO us -- staring AT us.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Okay, Richard. I’m going to hand you this phone now... Shaw is 45. Grim as hell, he dials a PHONE, hands it TO us. We are: INT. BOBI’S APT. (GEORGIA) - DAY (1996) RICHARD JEWELL, seated opposite them on a sofa, eyes the phone. He’s 34, Georgian, shy, stocky, unathletic (and -- if these feds are right -- a killer, a mad bomber).

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: When you hear a BEEP on the other end, I want you to say into it, ‘There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes.’

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, what?

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: We need a voice exemplar. Like ya to say it a few times.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: ‘There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes.’ Might be the only way to clear your name, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I wanna help you fellas. I’m law enforcement, too, same as you.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Then you should know better than anyone else how evidentiary something like this could be. (as Jewell tightens) ‘There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes.’ Might be the only way to clear your name, Richard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 2.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It’s not a request. Then, quietly -- steels himself. There Park. Good. There Park. Again series. The phone BEEPS. Jewell takes it,

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) is a bomb in Centennial You have thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Again, please. Louder.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) is a bomb in Centennial You have thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: In fact, let’s just doa Jewell tightens, perspiring. We PUSH IN ON HIM as: There Park. There Park. There Park. There Park. There

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: isa You isa You isa You isa You isa

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: bomb have bomb have bomb have bomb have in Centennial thirty minutes. in Centennial thirty minutes. in Centennial thirty minutes. in Centennial thirty minutes. SLAM CUT TO BLACK. 10 YEARS EARLIER -- 1986 -- ATLANTA, GA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell, 50 clipboard in hand, carefully catalogues AISLES of pens, tape, etc. Supplies are his domain. He wears a uniform top and khakis.  RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 3. INT. U.S. SMALL BUSINESS ADMIN. - SUITE/BRYANT’S OFFICE -

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Jewell pushes his SUPPLY CART through the suite like an unseen shadow -- offering a shy smile to all he sees. He’s just passing by some lawyer’s OPEN OFFICE DOOR, when: -.. he hears half of a PHONE CONVERSATION from within -- that UNSEEN LAWYER shredding someone:

dialogues.speaker: UNSEEN LAWYER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I don’t GIVE a damn! You are violating the most basic and sacred rights of business owner who doesn’t have the means to fight you! So I’m going to fight you. And I’m going to bury you until you do right by her! Whoever this guy is, he’s fearless. Jewell stays in place.

dialogues.speaker: UNSEEN LAWYER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Listen, if you wanna threaten me, do it to my face. We’re at 233 Peachtree. 19th floor. C’mon by, we validate. (then; calmly) Good talking to you, too, Senator. Senator? Whoa. The call ends, Jewell FROZEN outside the door. He starts to push his CART away, just as -- oh, no Unseen Lawyer, WATSON BRYANT, leans out of that office:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Who are you? Bryant is 35, a Southern preppy in a three-piece suit. Jewell tightens, caught.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I’m Richard, sir. I’m sorry I was listening. I don’t want you to think I’m rude. I’m not like that.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You always start every sentence with ‘I’? Jewell reddens a bit, Bryant enjoying the guy’s torment. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 4.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Sorry. I’m the supply room clerk.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Good. I need some more ta--

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: -- Second drawer of your desk, sir. Tape and a new box of pens. Huh? Bryant crosses to his DESK, opens the second drawer. Tape awaits. And a new box of pens. He eyes Jewell.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Saw you were running low. Look in the next drawer down. Bryant opens the bottom drawer. Five SNICKERS BARS stare back at him. He studies Jewell, almost spooked.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: How'd you know I liked Snickers?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Saw wrappers in your trash can.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Richard, from now on, your name is ‘Radar.’ That felt like a compliment. Jewell half-smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell fires a GUN -- his stance professional, his focus singular and sober, his eyes cold. BANG! BANG! But: The gun is PLASTIC, and he’s firing at a VIDEO SCREEN -- the only adult in this MALL ARCADE filled with KIDS. Down goes a bad guy, then another. BELLS RING! He’s just set a “NEW RECORD SCORE!” Kids in here turn. One of them (JASPER, 10) eyes Jewell: TEACH ME! PLEASE!

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (still firing) I leave the blue invaders be. Waste of ammo.

dialogues.speaker: JASPER
dialogues.text: Whoa. Thanks... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 5.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: That’s Jewell: an arcade hero. He glances to his right and FREEZES awkwardly -- just saw someone entering: It's Bryant, entering this same arcade -- a large soda from Chick-fil-A in hand. Bryant pauses, wasn’t expecting to see Jewell here. But now he’d look like a shit if he walked away, so... He reluctantly drifts toward Jewell, who fires again.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Nice shooting, Radar. Come here often?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: It’s practice for my career in law enforcement, sir. APD, FBI.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: What the hell would ya wanna do that for? An instant distaste for authority. Jewell notes it.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Believe in protectin’ people, sir. Bryant puts coins in the neighboring machine, starts firing. That fast, they’re side-by-side, semi-competing.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I study the Penal Code every night.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Is that so? (keeps firing) What’s the violation number for public intoxication?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: OCGA 16-11-1, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (mildly threatened) Domestic battery?

dialogues.speaker: OCGA 16-5-23.
dialogues.text: Jewell is rattling all of this off while kicking Bryant’s ass in the video game. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 6.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You’re pretty methodical.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I do like to go from A to B to C to D. This going from A straight to D and arguing over everything, I say no. Bryant’s GAME ends. Jewell throws a quick look at Bryant’s score, trying to be charitable.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: That’s pretty good, for a first time.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: First time? Ya know what? Bryant reaches into his pocket, pulls out EIGHT QUARTERS, slams them down. A challenge. Jewell notes them.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: They only gimme a half-hour for lunch, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You can say you were with me. He pumps another quarter into the machine. Game on. We DROP -—

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE ARCADE
dialogues.text: LOOKING IN on them -- two “grown men” in a video shootout. Loving it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell, no cart tonight, drifts through the STACKS -- law books, criminal codes. Then he STOPS:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Mister Bryant? REVEAL Bryant, at a table, reading. He looks up, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Yes? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 7.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna be workin’ here anymore. Came t’say bye. (off Bryant's surprised) I got a new job in security. Start tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: That’s great, Radar! It’s law enforcement, like you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Yeah. My mom’s taking me out tonight to buy some neckties and stuff. Gotta dress right.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I suppose you do.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Goin’ to T.J. Maxx. Anyway, thanks. For everything -- He starts toward Bryant, who tightens. Is he going to hug me? Ask me to adopt him? Bryant bracing -- But Jewell simply lays something on the table -- A SNICKERS BAR. Bryant stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Saw you were running low... Jewell’s shy, odd kindness again. Bryant eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Ya got enough money, Richard? For all those neckties you need?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I guess. Bryant extracts his wallet and pulls out a $100 bill. Jewell’s eyes go wide. Bryant hands the $100 to Jewell.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I don’t underst--

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: This comes with a quid pro quo. Ya know what that is?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Yeah, Latin. This for that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 8.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: That's right. Fair exchange. So, here it is: When you get your badge -- and I can see that day is coming -- don’t become an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Huh? Why would I become an...

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: A little power can turn a person into a monster, Richard. Don’t let that happen to you. Understand? Jewell has NO idea how to respond. Bryant just stares.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I’‘ll get this back to you, sir. First paycheck. I promise. Bryant breathes out a disappointed/ironic smile, well aware that nothing he said has sunk in.

dialogues.speaker: AFTERNOON, (1996)
dialogues.text: TIGHT SHOTS of a COP: Badge. Maglite. Nightstick. Danner APB police boots. Taser. SIDEARM. Serious shit. He is: Jewell, 10 YEARS LATER, the most serious CAMPUS COP ever, scowling his way down a DORMITORY HALLWAY toward a room. SUPERIMPOSE: 1996 -- PIEDMONT UNIVERSITY. DEMOREST, GA. He raps on ROOM 201’s door with his NIGHTSTICK. We hear the SHATTERING of a BOTTLE within. And drunk LAUGHTER as:

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: You dumbass!

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: I got flustered! Get the door! They crack up. Jewell raps again; doesn’t think drinking on campus is funny. At all. The door opens, but -- STUDENT #1 sees Jewell and SHUTS THE DOOR AGAIN. We hear:

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: It’s that rent a cop! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 9.

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: Shit! A beat. Jewell waiting. The door opens again... and:

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: Yes, Officer? Jewell doesn’t speak -- just pushes the door open with his NIGHTSTICK, very Clint Eastwood... then enters. Silence. The broken BOTTLE OF SCOTCH lies on the floor. He notes the BEER POSTERS on the walls. Shakes his head, brushes aside a chunk of wet glass with his police boot. And the kids lose it, laughing aloud. Jewell really hates that. He gets in Student #1’s face, too close:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Somethin’ you wanted t’say?

dialogues.speaker: STUDENT
dialogues.text: Yes, are you familiar with the notion of unlawful search and --

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: -- Keep pushing me. Keep testing me. See if you like where it gets you. Jewell leans in. Student #1 steps back, but slips and falls backward to the floor. THUMP. He’s unhurt -- but Jewell is instantly panicked: I almost hurt someone. Silence hangs. The kids don’t know what to do. Jewell tries to cover with bravado, but it’s an act:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I told you, no drinking on my campus. Remember? Now get up. INT. PIEDMONT COLLEGE - CLEERE’S OFFICE - DAY Jewell sits opposite DR. W. RAY CLEERE, 60, the PRESIDENT of this college. Cleere studies Jewell’s thick FILE.

dialogues.speaker: CLEERE
dialogues.text: I don’t know why no one called my attention to your file before. All these complaints about you. Physically assaulting a student. And have you really been pulling people over on the highway? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 10.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Yes, I have, sir. Figured if you do drunk tests on the road, the trouble never gets to the campus.

dialogues.speaker: CLEERE
dialogues.text: We don’t have any jurisdiction on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I believe in law and order, sir. Can't have a country without it.

dialogues.speaker: CLEERE
dialogues.text: (re: file) You were dismissed from the Habersham County Sheriff's Office?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: -- You said you didn’t want any Mickey-Mousing on your campus.

dialogues.speaker: CLEERE
dialogues.text: When did I say that?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Founders’ Day, last year. Remember, sir? By the punch bowl. I introduced myself and told you I was gonna be the best campus officer you ever saw. You said, ‘That’s fine. I don’t want any Mickey-Mousing on these grounds.’ Jewell takes out his OFFICIAL NOTEPAD, opens it:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: ‘No Mickey-Mousing on these grounds.’ See? You said it. Now, what about the kids in that dormitory, drinkin’ and everything? You just gonna let that go on?

dialogues.speaker: CLEERE
dialogues.text: Do you want to resign -- or would it be better if I fired you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet DAVE DUTCHESS blasting away with a DEER RIFLE. Jewell’s in the next lane with a Rambo-worthy SIG-400 ASSAULT RIFLE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 11.

dialogues.speaker: DUTCHESS
dialogues.text: It was a shit job anyway, hassling college brats. ‘Sides, there’s gonna be so much security work the next couple months, you’re set.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I worked hard at that job. Those kids were just runnin’ wild.

dialogues.speaker: DUTCHESS
dialogues.text: Olympics're comin’, brother. You can police the whole world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DEAD MAN lies in an ALLEY. Stab wounds all over him. KATHY SCRUGGS eyes the body dispassionately. She’s 35, beauty-pageant pretty. Blonde hair, blue eyes. Brassy, sexy, and profane. Also a dogged and prolific reporter.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: First dead body? Beside her is a YOUNG PHOTOGRAPHER who just might vomit. But Kathy looks gleeful, breathing in the ugliness.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: This part is crucial. It’s called the Homicide High-Step. She straddles the body carefully, respecting the crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I’ve got a gun in my glove compartment. That didn’t help. Kathy uses a PEN to peel back the victim’s COAT, revealing a disembodied FINGER.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Yep. Pinkie came clean off. That happens in stabbings sometimes. Photographer swallows a gag. Kathy loves that.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Isn’t there something pre-Olympic we could be doing right now? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 12.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Honey, there’1ll be 15,000 reporters in town to cover the Games. Shouldn’t somebody tell this poor shithead’s story?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: Not much for sentiment, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: His disaster could be your opportunity. Now click away. Just then, a SQUAD CAR pulls up. And two COPS get out... not surprised to see that Kathy has beaten them here.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Fellas! What took y’all so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the ATLANTA JOURNAL-CONSTITUTION (the “AJC”). Busy. Tense. A mounted DIGITAL CLOCK is counting down: 2 Days, 4 Hours, 6 Minutes, 32 Seconds, 31, 30... until the lighting of the torch. And this paper is ready as -- Kathy storms through the newsroom toward BRANDON HAMM.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. What’d he assign you?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: The ‘Celebrations at Centennial Park!’ Woo-hoo. Something finally happens in this city and I get a Kenny Rogers concert!

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Could be worse. Could be Equestrian.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I’m getting my tits done. Soon.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: Not sure how that applies here --

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: By this time next year we’re all gonna be scrambling for jobs on TV. Maybe a C-cup? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 11 12 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 13.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She does a mini-shimmy. A few FEMALE REPORTERS two desks away look on disapprovingly. Hamm smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: I'd miss you, Kathy. Even if they wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: (loud; at the women) Girls, I’m sorry all my hot-ass murders keep knocking your boring bullshit off the front page! (at Hamm) Wanna get a drink?

dialogues.speaker: HAMM
dialogues.text: I’d only slow you down. She walks away. Hamm grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom Shaw is seething. Glaring. Just got assigned to:

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: ‘Centennial Park’? What the fuck! INT. BRYANT’S LAW OFFICE - RECEPTION/OFFICE - MORNING 12 A cramped RECEPTION DESK manned by NADYA LIGHT: lovely, fierce, Jewish, Russian-born, has a mini TV on her desk. To her right is a COPIER IN A CLOSET. To her left is -- Bryant, in a TINY OFFICE, wearing HIKING SHORTS and a polo shirt, his receding hairline hidden under a BALL CAP. Reading a novel. His view is a BRICK WALL. No more U.S. Small Business Admin. No more 3-piece suits. A SIGN on his credenza reads, “I Fear Government More Than I Fear Terrorism.” What happened to him? Something’s off here. Nadya leans in -- she’s got a great Russian accent:

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: Watson, we’re out of toner.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Okay. She waits for him to understand. He doesn’t. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 13 14 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 14.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: If I go out, you’ll have to answer the phones.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Oh. I’11 go, then. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: There’s a sale at the Walmart. Ten percent off if you can name anyone from the U.S. Olympic Team.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (reflex-grumpiness ) Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: I know: people smiling for sixteen days. It’s going to be awful.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: No, it’s going to be WONDERFUL. For Coca-Cola, CNN... and anyone with a parking lot. Out he goes. EXT. BOBI’S APT. BLDG. - PARKING LOT/GROUNDS - DAY 13 A huge, EMPTY parking lot, ringed by low-rent two-story structures and woods. A half-empty, brush-filled swimming pool sits close by the HIGHWAY. INT. BOBI’S APT. - LIVING ROOM/KITCHEN - MORNING 14 We've been here before. A PLAQUE says, “A Home Without a Dog is just a House.” A PORTRAIT of Jewell (ina HABERSHAM COUNTY DEPUTY SHERIFF’s uniform) hangs on the wall. Jewell, in a polo shirt with an AT&T LOGO on the front -- (“SECURITY” across the back) eats a DONUT while watching a TV REPORT on MICHAEL JOHNSON, World’s Fastest Human. BARBARA “BOBI” JEWELL, mom, is baking five POUND CAKES, a side business. Her dog BRANDI hovers.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: (from the kitchen) Can you believe it’s really here? An Olympics! In our city! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 15.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (from the sofa) This is it, Momma. My one moment in time. I prove myself, somebody’11 make me a cop again.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: That's right, baby. Bobi hobbles (bad foot) to the sink. Jewell drifts in.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I been thinking. I’m not gonna move out ‘til after you’ve had your surgery. You might need me around. Would that be all right?

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: You get goin’ now. We can tend to all that when the Games are over. But none of that heavy foot of yours driving there. No heavy foot!

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I won’t, ma’am. I won’t, Mother.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: ‘Cause why?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: ‘Cause wherever I’m goin’ it’1l still be there ten minutes later.

dialogues.speaker: BOBI
dialogues.text: That’s right. Give Momma a kiss. He obeys. Bobi smiles. Then, a moment of doubt --

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: It is law enforcement, ain’t it? Even if I’m just guardin’ a bunch of stereo equipment.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Heck, yes! You're still a good guy wardin’ off bad guys, ain’t ya?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: OK mama, I’1l see you at the park. Jewell smiles; Bobi’s his rock. He starts to head out.  15 16 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 16.

dialogues.speaker: NEARLY BLINDING US...
dialogues.text: REVEAL: NBC’S BROADCAST -- MUHAMMAD ALI lighting the Olympic Torch with an entire stadium cheering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pageantry. The Games of Atlanta, 1996, have begun. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIREWORKS light up a night sky over this park. It is the place to celebrate. Every night of these games. 60,000 PEOPLE on 21 acres rimmed by downtown high-rises. A giant neon COCA-COLA SIGN atop the tallest of them. FOUNTAINS spurt water into the air; KIDS run through. Joy. Pride. And KENNY ROGERS in concert! People dance, sing, pose for PICTURES. Shirtless men, girls in tank tops. A hot, sexy night, America hosting the world. A GUY calls out --

dialogues.speaker: PARTY OF THE CENTURY, BABY
dialogues.text: Bobi laughs as she sings along with “The Gambler” on stage. Clapping. So much fun. The stage is run from a SOUND AND LIGHT TOWER 100 feet away -- 5 stories of steel, covered with white plastic siding. KIDS gather here, on benches, swapping OLYMPIC PINS. But we don’t see much SECURITY. Gates are unmanned. The entries are porous. Targets everywhere, unprotected. Tom Shaw is here. So bored. And angry about it. He spots Kathy Scruggs, equally bored. Heads over.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Hello, Kathy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 17 18 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 17.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Happiest Place on Earth! Fucking nightmare. Isn’t there anything crime-y goin’ on anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Hell if I know. I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Christ. Wanna dance?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Love to, but I’m on duty.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Fuck duty. She starts to dance up against him. He grins.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Jewell, in his SECURITY GUARD shirt, lugs VIDEO EQUIPMENT up stairs behind NBC cameraman, into:

dialogues.speaker: CAMERAMAN
dialogues.text: Anywhere’s fine. Thanks, man.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No trouble. You need anything else up here? SEVERAL TECHS are busily working. They wave, no thanks.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Jewell descends... to find TWO OTHER SECURITY GUARDS (ROB and LONNY) scrawling GRAFFITI on the stairwell steps.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: What’re you guys doing?

dialogues.speaker: ROB
dialogues.text: Leavin’ our mark. Here’s what they wrote: “Welcome to the Coca-Cola Olympics!” And “American by Birth, Southern by the Grace of God.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 18.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: First Olympics the South’s ever had and you guys do that? Didn’t your folks teach you any better? (as they shrug) Life’s tough. Tougher when you're stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music blares. Jewell stands guard, vigilant and alert. A PREGNANT WOMAN walks by. Jewell’s reaction is instant:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Do you need some water, ma’am?

dialogues.speaker: PREGNANT WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Water? It’s a warm night. He reaches UNDER a bench where HIS COOLER sits. Inside, WATER and COKES on ice. He grabs one of each.

dialogues.speaker: PREGNANT WOMAN
dialogues.text: You’re just giving ‘em away?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I keep ‘em here for pregnant women and police officers. She takes the water, a bit suspect of his Boy-Scoutness.

dialogues.speaker: PREGNANT WOMAN
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Have a good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music rocking. Kathy dances, tipsy/sexy... Shaw is a few feet away, trying to scan the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Why so grim, big guy?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I’m bored. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 21 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 19.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: We’re all bored.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I was born for better! Kathy laughs, keeps dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three ATLANTA PD COPS (MAX GREEN, MIKE SILVER, and WILL JONES) grouse with BILL MILLER of the Georgia Bureau of Investigation (GBI). Jewell approaches, handing them each a COKE. They nod, as:

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: All these athletes complainin’ ‘bout gettin’ to their venues late on account of the traffic, and I’m thinkin’, ‘What about the COPS? We can’t get anywhere, either.’

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: I was half-ready to run my siren last night just so I could get to the supermarket, so damn crowded. PEOPLE AMBLE PAST -- the cops barely paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: It's just poor planning by the Olympic Committee. There ain’t a one of them jake-legs has got a damn clue about traffic patterns.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: (knows already) Whadda you think, Richard? You think that committee’s a buncha jake-legs?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. They got a heckuva job to do, coordinating all this. And MARTA, don’t forget. I’m glad I don’t hafta do it. (as the cops chuckle) What? It’s tough to get all this logistics right all the time.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: Shit, Richard, they ain’t listening in on us. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 22 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 20.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They laugh. Then something turns Jewell’s head: A WHITE MALE, bearing a BACKPACK, walking BY us -- LONG HAIR, tattoos beneath a TANK TOP, and sunglasses. Something about him -- and that backpack...

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Hey, any’a you-all ever seen that guy before? The cops shake their heads, unalarmed. Jewell thinking.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: That backpack look funny to you?

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: Funny how? Jewell doesn’t reply, just drifts toward the WHITE MALE. The COPS laugh. We STAY WITH JEWELL -- passing through:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one’s on stage; “MACARENA” plays over loudspeakers, the CONCERT CROWD dancing. But not Jewell. His eyes are riveted on that WHITE MALE, bearing that BACKPACK through the thick crowd. +.. right past Kathy. And Shaw. --. Jewell gets closer, White Male reaches the barrier near the stage. Now Jewell KNOWS something’s wrong. White Male takes off his backpack, starts to unzip it. Time to move. NOW. Jewell pushes past people in the crowd. White Male pulls a BEER from the backpack. Then another beer, then two more. Oh. Jewell freezes. The White Male turns to his friends and surprises them with beers. Jewell realizes he was wrong, is embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 23 24 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 21. INT. BOBI’S APT. —- JEWELL’S ROOM/LIVING ROOM - AFTERNOON Jewell sits on his bed, ill today -- nauseous, pale, and sweaty -- wearing his AT&T SECURITY shirt. Bobi watches more Olympic coverage: TOM BROKAW of NBC.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: My, he is handsome. You don’t want a sandwich or anything, Baby?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Naw, I don’t feel well, Momma. My stomach.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Somethin’ you ate?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Guess so.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Why you eat at those places... He eyes this tiny apartment, angry at himself...

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: What, baby?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Nothin’. Just... World owes you better ‘n this, Momma.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: World owes us both. But this is what we got. Now go do your job. Bobi pulls him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another 60,000-PERSON PARTY, like an Olympic Town Square. On stage, JACK MACK AND THE HEART ATTACK are playing. Jewell stands his post at the tower, nearly doubled over from cramps. Officer Green kids him about it:

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: This could be a good thing.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Yeah? How? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 24 25 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 22.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: We could bring you out to the diving venue and have you fart the Chinese National Anthem. (as Jewell’s a blank) Why don’t you switch shifts with someone? Go home?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: This is my favorite band. I’m okay.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: Jack Mack is your favorite band?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I‘ll be fine. The raucous crowd cheers. Feels like the whole world is celebrating. Jewell runs off, hurting -- as we: A FAMILY drifts by: The BRADENS -- MOM, DAD, JERROD (8), MARIAH (6). A cotton-candy dream of a night for them.

dialogues.speaker: MARIAH
dialogues.text: (gymnastic leap) Look, Mommy! I’m Kerri Strug!

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRADEN, (DAD)
dialogues.text: Hold it! Do that again. He grabs his video camera. Mariah happily performs. Mom and dad beam, just a few feet from Jewell’s bench. We SEE THE VIDEO THEY’RE SHOOTING -- dark, grainy. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell, in knots, cramping, runs up to Bill Miller of

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I’ll be back.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Go! Miller chuckles. Jewell runs for a RESTROOM -- +.. right past Tom Shaw, who is ever-watchful... as: Outside the sound and light tower -- Mariah hams it up for the camera. Her brother Jerrod, too, stag-leaping, as: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 26 27 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 23.

dialogues.speaker: JERROD
dialogues.text: Look, Dad! I’m Mitch Gaylord! Dad, right in front of Jewell’s BENCH, tapes it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell hurries through the crowd -- passing a GAY COUPLE, two MUSLIMS, a SIKH, a MIXED-RACE COUPLE kissing. Foreign LANGUAGES in the air. A BEER gets spilled on his shirt by DRUNK PARTIERS who don’t even notice. Jewell tightens and continues along, invisible among the music, the energy, the joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Jerrod does another stag-leap beside his sister.

dialogues.speaker: MR. BRADEN
dialogues.text: Okay. Enough gymnastics? He heads toward them... We notice something, unattended: A MILITARY BACKPACK laying under Jewell’s BENCH. It’s BIG, olive green. (The Army calls them ALICE PACKS.) Mariah just noticed it. She drifts toward it, curious... reaches out to touch it as --

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘Scuse me. Jewell, returning to his post. Mrs. Braden looks up --

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRADEN, (MOM)
dialogues.text: Mariah! You leave that alone. It isn’t yours to play with! Mariah stiffens. Jewell smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Better listen to your ma. Mariah obeys. Jewell now a foot from the ALICE PACK as: SOUNDS echo from the FENCE BEHIND THE AT&T TOWER: drunken LAUGHTER and BOTTLES BREAKING. Jewell heads around the tower. We FOLLOW... to find: TEN DRUNK TEENS throwing empty beer bottles at the back of the sound and light tower. Laughing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 24.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Hey, y’all gotta stop doin’ that. They regard him: a heavyset guy in an AT&T shirt.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK TEEN
dialogues.text: What’re you gonna do, cancel my phone service? His buddies laugh. A TV CAMERA CREW passes by. The Drunks holler, trying to get the crew’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK TEENS
dialogues.text: Put us on TV! The crew ignores them. Jewell stays on task:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: The cops aren’t gonna ask as nicely. They get you for drunk and disorderly, that’s cuffs anda night in the lockup.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK TEEN
dialogues.text: They'd have to CATCH me first. Which ain’t gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK TEEN
dialogues.text: I’m Michael Johnson, world’s fastest man. Wanna see my medal? MORE HUGE LAUGHS. This is a goner. Jewell turns -- walks back around the tower toward Bill Miller of GBI.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Hey, I got some drunks back there breaking bottles on the tower. Maybe they’11 listen to you. (as Miller groans) People respect a badge. Miller goes... which is when Jewell STOPS... and NOTICES That ALICE PACK under his bench. It’s BIG. Very. He studies it, his face blank -- then calls out to Miller:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: And see if any of ‘em left a backpack under my bench. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 28 29 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 25.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: What is it with you and backpacks? Jewell shrugs, regarding the ALICE pack. Miller goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slow night -- as a 9-1-1 OPERATOR takes a call:

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (into headset) 9-1-1. She hears a MALE VOICE through a BAFFLING DEVICE:

dialogues.speaker: MALE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (through headset) Can you understand me?

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (into headset) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MALE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (through headset) You defy the order of the militia.

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (into headset) What? CLICK. Operator shrugs, annoyed. Back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell stares at that ALICE PACK. The concert is just b.g. noise now. He checks his WATCH as Miller returns:

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: It ain’t theirs.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No? Miller shakes his head. They look around: THOUSANDS of people out here, dancing. But no one close enough to belong to that backpack.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Okay. We got a suspicious package. Better call it in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29 30 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 26.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Miller eyes it, unalarmed. But Jewell seems so sure...

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Probably just somebody run off drunk and forgot they left it.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let’s call it in anyway.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we unzip it and see what's in there first?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t. There’s a protocol. Miller steps toward it... But the closer he gets to the ALICE pack, the bigger it looks. So he STOPS, irritated.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch had to get left under your bench, didn’t it. He grabs his radio. Jewell approaches Green of APD:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: We got a suspicious package -- need to clear these people out.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: Hang on, hang on. What package? Jewell nods toward the ALICE pack. Green eyes it.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: Probably nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Yeah, but... Need a perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: Shit, Richard. Could be just filled with BEER?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: It ain’t beer. I know it. Jewell eyes that TOWER -- the ALICE pack sitting up against its base -- and he heads inside. Green sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell rushes in to the SOUND ROOM where FOUR TECHS barely look up from the board. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 31 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 27.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: We have a situation downstairs. Need you guys to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND TECH
dialogues.text: What kinda situation?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: A suspicious package in front of the tower. Law enforcement is aware of it and on the scene.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND TECH
dialogues.text: Well, if the cops tell us we have to go, we'll go. (as Jewell eyes them) Band's in the middle of a set. We can’t just shut down.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I come back here, there’ll be no questions, no hesitation. You're just gettin’ the hell out, yeah? Everyone nods. He counts the heads in the room. FOUR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 10 DRUNK TEENS eye the ALICE pack, NO IDEA that it’s the reason the cops need a perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK TEEN
dialogues.text: I think we should take it.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK TEEN
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ A.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK TEEN
dialogues.text: I think we should take it to the House of Blues, and see if there’s anything in it we can sell.

dialogues.speaker: DRUNK TEEN
dialogues.text: Clutch idea. Drunk #1 reaches down, GRABS THE ALICE PACK --

dialogues.speaker: SILVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! You leave that alone and get out of here! Drunk #1 releases the ALICE pack. But in the process he moves it without meaning to so it’s no longer sitting up.  32 33 34 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameraman and a TEEN INTERN here. Jewell enters.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Need you to clear out. Got a bomb scare in front of the tower. That got the Teen’s attention, fast. He stands.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERAMAN
dialogues.text: We get bomb threats all the time in D.C. They’re never anything.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN INTERN
dialogues.text: Cool for you. But I’m outta here. The kid leaves. Cameraman grabs his CAMERA, follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy sits on a wall, awaiting a shuttle bus. Bored. RON MARTZ (former Marine, fellow reporter) comes by.

dialogues.speaker: MARTZ
dialogues.text: Local cop discovered yesterday that he’s actually second-cousins with a Polish gymnast. Is that a story?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Doesn’t get me hard.

dialogues.speaker: MARTZ
dialogues.text: I know. Me neither. Kathy shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell emerges, sees Silver of APD. The CONCERT in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Got eleven people still inside.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: You know this is a false alarm. Jewell smiles thinly as a BOMB DIAGNOSTIC TEAM arrives. Two guys, ZOELLER and FORSYTHE, in shorts, as:  35 36 37 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another call comes in:

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (into headset) 9-1-1. Same MALE VOICE -- this time pinching his nose:

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (through headset) There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes. CLICK. He hangs up. Huh? OPERATOR #2 punches something into her computer, then turns, confused, to OPERATOR #3:

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Do you know the address to Centennial Park? I just got this man talking about there’s a bomb set to go off in thirty minutes in Centennial Park. But the computer won't process it.

dialogues.speaker: 9-1-1 OPERATOR
dialogues.text: What? Lord, child. You spelling it wrong. It’s C-E-N-T-E-N...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN wearing a FISHERMAN’S HAT, his BACK TO us, hangs up the receiver at a BANK OF 10 PAY PHONES and walks away...

dialogues.speaker: TIME
dialogues.text: ALICE HAWTHORNE and her daughter FALLON (14) are beside the sound and light tower -- Fallon posing for a picture. Jewell approaches, calm but firm:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Folks, need you to move away from the tower, please... Huh? Alice looks around, sees Officers Green, Silver, Jones, and Miller quietly moving people away. Odd.

dialogues.speaker: FALLON
dialogues.text: I’m getting tired, Mom. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 30.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE HAWTHORNE
dialogues.text: Me, too. Let’s take the last of these pictures and go home. Off they go, unfazed. No one out here looks alarmed. Jewell approaches PARTIERS on a knoll behind the tower.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Need you folks to clear the area, please. Need a perimeter here.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: You go, Richard! Jewell keeps at it. We DRIFT TOWARD THE BENCH, where -- Bomb-team-guy Zoeller lies on his back, looking at the ALICE pack with a PENLIGHT. Opens the flap, slowwwwwwly. THREE PIPES inside. And wires. A BOMB. Oh, fuck. Zoeller FREEZES, then inches away from the bomb, his arms never moving from that same position -- Gets to his partner, FAST. Jewell notices. They all do.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: They told us in training: ‘You ever see a bomb guy go pale, RUN.’

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: Amen, brother. Zoeller and Forsythe consult in hushed tones... Jewell and the COPS drifting in. Then Zoeller turns:

dialogues.speaker: ZOELLER
dialogues.text: We have three pipe bombs inside that pack, big as I’ve ever seen. I want a hundred-foot perimeter cleared immediately. Oh. The cops eye one another.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: You guys got a bomb blanket or -- ?

dialogues.speaker: FORSYTHE
dialogues.text: The Render-Safe team can be here in 20 minutes. He steps away to radio it in. Everyone standing still. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37 38 39 40 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 31.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: Richard, I’m never givin’ you shit about anything ever again.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: You said it, bubba.

dialogues.speaker: SILVER
dialogues.text: Let’s just go to work. The COPS find a different gear now, fanning out urgently. Jewell has one thought: the people inside that tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell bursts in. The same TECHS are at the soundboard.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: You guys gotta get outta here. NOW. (as everyone freezes) We've got a bomb. NOW. Three guys head out. A FOURTH GUY tries to gather a bunch of VIDEOTAPES. Jewell pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Y'hear? Down the stairs! Go! Fourth guy heads for the stairs. We RETURN TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell bursts in, finds a GUY WORKING A SPOTLIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: We're evacuating. Go. Spotlight guy starts to power his equipment down -- but Jewell GRABS HIM, pushes him to the door.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Go! Pushing him into the STAIRWELL -- SHOT CONTINUING -- where Jewell looks down, counts 11 PEOPLE descending...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice Hawthorne poses for a shot in front of a BRASS STATUE. Her daughter Fallon frames it up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 41 42 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 32.

dialogues.speaker: FALLON
dialogues.text: Smile! Alice smiles. Fallon takes the picture. But:

dialogues.speaker: ALICE HAWTHORNE
dialogues.text: I blinked. Take another one! Fallon lifts the camera again... EXT. CENTENNIAL PARK - THE CROWD — SAME TIME 41 People dancing, partying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Urgent movement. COPS SHOUTING, people moving back. Tom Shaw is part of the effort now. Jewell emerges from the Sound and Light tower. He spots Green:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Building’s clear.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: You should get outta here, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. You, too. They both start pushing people back, but folks are slow to respond. It’s a party, isn’t it? Behind the tower, Jewell comes upon a NECKING COUPLE.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Need you two to clear outta here. They keep kissing. We RETURN TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE BENCH
dialogues.text: ... where the ALICE pack sits...

dialogues.speaker: THE STATUE
dialogues.text: Fallon taking a last picture of her mother... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 42 43 44 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 33.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUNDS
dialogues.text: Shaw, Miller, urging people to move, when -- INT. BOBI’S APT. - BEDROOM - SAME TIME 43 Bobi is sound asleep. Suddenly, her eyes SNAP OPEN -- as if startled by an urgent and horrible dream. She gasps --

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Richard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEWELL -- behind the tower, moving in on that couple while checking his WATCH --

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I’m not kidding. Y'all gotta -- Just then, BOOOOM! A CONCUSSIVE EXPLOSION. DEATH ITSELF. And the world just STOPS. Jewell and the couple are knocked flat. (But the tower itself has protected them.) We -- CUT TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS
dialogues.text: For a moment -- a feeling of surreality. The SOUND OF SHRAPNEL SIZZLING PAST US like rifle fire, eerie... Then we HEAR -- SCREAMS. TERROR. We're blind, until we SLAM UP ON -- Jewell’s eyes opening foggily. He turns, in SLOW MOTION, and sees a HORROR: COPS FLYING THROUGH THE AIR -- Miller, Green, Silver, Jones, Shaw -- And Jewell’s BENCH, rocketing upwards. SMOKE pluming. The SIDING torn off the AT&T tower -- and worst of all -- ALICE HAWTHORNE -- spinning in a 360, then falling. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 34.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then... an unearthly SILENCE. END SLOW MOTION as we bleed in more sounds of SCREAMS, PANIC, terror, confusion. Good God. Pieces of NAILS start falling to the ground like noisy drops of rain. PING. TING. PING-TING. The kissing couple beside Jewell is catatonic, barely breathing.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: You two okay? You okay? They nod, sort of. He crawls away -- around the tower -- to find sheer, bloody carnage -- a BATTLEFIELD: WOUNDED everywhere. COPS laid out. People senseless. Alice Hawthorne dead. Fallon dazed, her arm bleeding. An unspeakable scene, smoke hanging. Over 100 people are down -- dazed, bleeding, flattened.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS PEOPLE
dialogues.text: I need a doctor!/I need help!/ Somebody! Help! NAMES called aloud:

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS PEOPLE
dialogues.text: Dad? Mom? Jewell turns: BYSTANDERS and MORE COPS are RUSHING TOWARD THE SCENE NOW. People reaching for cell phones. A TURKISH CAMERAMAN races in, ready to start shooting. But the guy COLLAPSES from a heart attack, dead on the spot. More people SCREAM. We WHIP BACK TO: Jewell, his eyes wide. There’s Green among the DOWNED COPS. Jewell gets to his feet, his balance shaky. He heads for Green, while stumbling past Shaw, and: Jewell gets to Green who is face-down, his jersey and flesh torn open by shrapnel.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: How bad?

dialogues.speaker: GREEN
dialogues.text: I’m fine, I’m fine. Go! More GROANS around them, more screams, more cries. Over Jewell’s shoulder, the tattered SOUND and LIGHT TOWER -- still standing, but its front side has been blown off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 45 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 35.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: You hang tough, brother. Help’s coming. Green nods. Blood everywhere... We hear our first SIREN now. Jewell moves toward Silver as: Incredibly, amid all this chaos, he sees TECHS racing back into the blown-up tower. He hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: What the hell’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SOUND TECH
dialogues.text: I left my laptop in there.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: You can get it in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND TECH
dialogues.text: It’s got all my WORK on it! I got shit in there, too!

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: NO ONE is going back inside this building until we know it’s structurally sound. There could be a SECOND device! The Techs turn away. Jewell hurries toward Silver, who's bleeding badly -- passing a dazed Bill Miller as: Miller numbly takes his WALLET out of his back pocket, to find a piece of SHRAPNEL stuck inside. His GBI BADGE just saved his ass. Literally. Shaw awakens. We CRANE UP to take in all this chaos. Panic, blood, terror, people running, ambulances speeding TOWARD us. A nightmare. And Jewell is in the middle of it all. We --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE HOUR LATER -- The BRASS STATUE where Alice Hawthorne had posed for a picture now has NAILS embedded in it. Another NAIL has been embedded in a KODAK CAMERA lying unclaimed on the ground. A NEWS CREW gets a shot of it. Barricades have been erected. EMTs at work. AMBULANCES everywhere. And a cluster-fuck by the TOWER -- guys from GBI, APD, ATF, USOC, arguing. Shaw’s among them, his forehead bleeding. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 45 46 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 36.

dialogues.speaker: APD COP
dialogues.text: This is homicide. It’s ours.

dialogues.speaker: GBI GUY
dialogues.text: This park is state property. That makes it ours!

dialogues.speaker: ATF GUY
dialogues.text: You guys can BOTH get the fuck out of here. This is ATF.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: No, YOU get the fuck out of here! This is OUR crime scene! Jewell walks past, dialing his cell.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into cell) Mom, it’s me. They had a bomb go off down here, but I am okay. Turn on the TV. Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atlanta locked down. BARRICADES. MILITARY VEHICLES. RAMPARTS. A red CNN glow behind every window. We FIND: Ron Martz of the AJC, shaken, standing at the gate of Centennial Park as wounded are rushed past. It’s an echo of Iraq for him. Suddenly, someone puts a hand on his: Kathy -- smiling warmly. Martz appreciates it. She shuts her eyes, lowers her head.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Dear God... whoever did this... Prayer. Nice. Martz shuts his eyes, too.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Please let us find him, before anyone else does. Martz’s eyes snap open. NOT praying this prayer anymore.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: And please, whoever he is... let him be fucking interesting. Amen. She releases Martz’s hand. He shakes his head.  47 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell stands outside the tattered tower. The ambulances are gone now. The wounded have all been moved. But the barricades remain, swarmed by LAW ENFORCEMENT. Eerie. He watches as they collect evidence and interview people. At his feet is a shard of what used to be HIS BENCH. He looks around, then pockets it. A souvenir.

dialogues.speaker: BARKER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you Jewell? Jewell whips around, caught. Oh, shit. Here comes TIM BARKER of AT&T, all business.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I was just --

dialogues.speaker: BARKER
dialogues.text: I’m Tim Barker, AT&T Media Relations. Did I hear this right? You discovered the bomb? Oh. Jewell relaxes, pleased.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BARKER
dialogues.text: That makes you a hero. Know that?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I was just doing my job, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BARKER
dialogues.text: That’s a nice thing to say, Richard. But we’ve had a lot of requests from people who’d like to talk to you. Would that be okay? (as Jewell just stares) CNN. Katie Couric. Those types. Your superior gave the okay.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: There were a LOT of police personnel here, sir, clearing people out. Wasn’t just me.

dialogues.speaker: BARKER
dialogues.text: You’re the one who spotted the package. You’re the one people want to hear from.  RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 38. 48 INT. “MAKEUP” TENT - DAY (LATER) 48 Jewell sits in a makeup chair. The MAKEUP GIRL finishes him off.

dialogues.speaker: MAKEUP GIRL
dialogues.text: You’re all set. They’1ll come get you in just a minute.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Thanks. She leaves. He regards himself in the mirror -- about to go on “The Today Show.” He gulps hard, looks up at GOD:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: God. I know you got other things on your mind right now, like catchin’ the guy who did this and all. But, seein’ as this is live TV, and I feel like I’m about to throw up inside my mouth... could you please make sure I don’t say anything stupid out there? Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49 INT. BOBI’S APT. - DAY 49 Bobi is watching TV, beaming, because Jewell is on the air, LIVE, being interviewed by Katie Couric.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE COURIC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on TV) Do you feel like a hero?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on TV) No, ma’‘am. I’m just a guy who did the job he was trained to do...

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: (so proud) My boy... 50 INT. BRYANT’S PRIVATE OFFICE - MORNING 50 Bryant’s at his desk, HEARING the Jewell interview via the TINY TV on Nadya’s desk in the next room -- finds it borderline unbelievable, but kind of thrilling.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Good for you, Radar...  51 52 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 39. EXT. CENTENNIAL PARK - “TODAY” SET - MORNING 51 Jewell leaves the set with Barker, passing TWO APD COPS:

dialogues.speaker: GRATEFUL APD COP
dialogues.text: Good job, Richard. Way to go, man. Acceptance from real cops. Very gratifying.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Hey, I was workin’ with a couple guys who were injured: Green? Silver? Miller? They okay?

dialogues.speaker: GRATEFUL APD COP
dialogues.text: Word is, all the cops are expected to make a full recovery.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Well, that’s great. Thanks. Then a GUY IN A GREAT SUIT approaches. Barker smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BARKER
dialogues.text: Richard, there’s someone I'd like you to meet. This is Mister Brenner from Bernstein & Crane. You know that company? They publish books.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNER, (GREAT SUIT GUY)
dialogues.text: Hello, Richard. I’d like to talk to you about your story. Ya free? Jewell feels a bit like he’s floating now. INT. BOBI’S APT. —- KITCHEN - DAY 52 Bobi bakes more pound cakes. TV on, LOCAL NEWS, another Jewell interview. TV is also on in the living room -- ABC -- yet another Jewell interview. He enters.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: You’re everywhere! And the phone never stops. I need a secretary!

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Momma, a guy from New York just asked me if I wanted to write a book! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 53 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 40.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Well, lah-dee-da!

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I don’t even have to DO anything. Someone else thinks it up and types it and all; I just say yes or no to stuff. For money!

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: You’re a ROCK STAR! Tom Brokaw was even talking about you! Jewell beams, catches a glimpse of himself in a MIRROR -- And there it is, for the first time ever: PRIDE -- a hero looking back at him. Feels GREAT. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Movement. Urgency. Agents responding to real crisis. BRUCE HUGHES, the SAC (Spec. Agent In Charge) of this field office, approaches Tom Shaw:

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE HUGHES
dialogues.text: Shaw. You doin’ okay?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Not really, sir. Fucking bomb went off on my watch. My fucking park.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE HUGHES
dialogues.text: We didn’t have enough eyeballs there. That’s on us. Let’s just catch the son of a bitch, yeah? Tom Shaw nods, grateful. That helped.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE HUGHES
dialogues.text: I need you to get out to Habersham County -- background on a former sheriff's deputy. Might have some connection to the bombing.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Oh? Who is he? Bruce Hughes pauses, knowing this is NOT a small piece of news:

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE HUGHES
dialogues.text: The security guard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53 54 55 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 41.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BANG. That fast, Tom Shaw has his man. And it’s Jewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell gets out of his PICKUP, ready for work. Instantly, PEOPLE notice him. PARENTS point him out to their KIDS. That feels great. And shockingly new. He passes a U.S. SWIMMER (we recognize the SWEATS on the guy); the Swimmer nods with great respect and:

dialogues.speaker: UNNAMED SWIMMER
dialogues.text: Way to go, man. Made us all real proud. Respect from an ATHLETE. Jewell beams, thrilled. But: INT. PIEDMONT UNIVERSITY - CLEERE’S OFFICE - DAY 55 Dr. W. Ray Cleere (who fired Jewell in this very office not long ago), studies Jewell’s old file. Opposite Cleere... is Tom Shaw.

dialogues.speaker: CLEERE
dialogues.text: I want to be clear -- I haven't accused him of anything.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: CLEERE
dialogues.text: I just... I see the attention he’s getting; it’s the KIND of attention he was always seeking here when he was harassing students, pulling people over on the highway. Crazy behavior. And I decided if my fears were correct -- if he WASN’T actually the hero they’re makin’ him out to be -- and I'd had information pertinent to that fact which I’d failed to bring to light? It could jeopardize lives.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Dr. Cleere, you did the right thing, calling. And we will look into it. Cleere nods. We FIND a PHOTO of Jewell, which BECOMES:  56 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHOTO of Jewell fills a screen. Bruce Hughes sighs:

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE HUGHES
dialogues.text: Why is the Goddamn ACOG re-opening that park? We don’t have shit. Ten other SENIOR FBI GUYS (and Tom Shaw) in here. An ERASURE BOARD reads “CENTBOM.” Tension, pressure...

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE HUGHES
dialogues.text: Okay. I want to hear more about Jewell. Patrick? All eyes on PATRICK WILLIAMS from the Behavioral Sciences Team --

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: When I look at Jewell, I think about the bomb scare at the L.A. Olympics in ‘84: a bag left ona bus by the same cop who then discovered it. And the fires in Idaho this summer -- started by a firefighter who wanted the credit for putting them out. There is a profile that emerges, the false hero. Tom Shaw believes that to his core. The whole room does.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: In interviews, Jewell’s account of the bombing seems vague, and he looks uncomfortable discussing the victims. I also found his mentioning on TV that he was hoping to get back into law enforcement a bit inappropriate. There’s a lot here that’s troubling. And everything Agent Shaw has learned about him does sync-up with this profile.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE HUGHES
dialogues.text: You agree with that, Tom?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: I do, sir. Bruce Hughes digests that... Then:

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE HUGHES
dialogues.text: Let’s put eyes on him. 56  RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 43. 57 INT. BRYANT’S OFFICE - DAY 57 Bryant reads the paper, annoyed by the society page.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Fools’ names and fools’ faces. Nadya leans in, mildly floored:

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: Watson? (as Bryant waits) Got a call for you.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Is it Bill Gates randomly wondering if I need a million dollars? ‘Cause if so, yes.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: It’s Richard Jewell. Bryant laughs, thinks she’s kidding. She isn’t.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: ‘Richard Jewell’ Richard Jewell?

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I see. Uh, okay. She disappears to her desk. Then LINE 1 lights up.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: 58 INT. BOBI’S APT. - SAME TIME 58 Jewell on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mister Bryant? I’m sorry to bother you, just got your number from Information. I hope you remember me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 44.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) Richard, you're a national hero now. You can call me Watson.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Oh. Thank you, sir. How are you? How’s your family?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) We’re all fine. I see you've moved up from video games!

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Didn't mean to, but yeah, guess I did.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) Well, good job, that’s a prideful thing. What can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Sir, have you ever done a book deal? Do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) Contracts are contracts. Why?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) This bomb thing. Got some New York guys asking me to write a book and I don’t know anything about that, so I thought maybe you could help me.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) I’d be happy to.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Are you not at the U.S. Small Business Admin anymore? I tried there first.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) No. I got outta there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 45.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Oh. How come?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) Lifestyle decision. You just make sure not to sign anything until I see it first. Okay? We’ll start there.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: ‘Kay. Thanks, Watson. Bryant ends the call. Kind of a stunned smile. Nadya leans in, pretty excited, as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaw, a drink before him, signals for a refill, as --

dialogues.speaker: KATHY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Must be a lotta heat on you guys. Shaw turns. Here’s Kathy, in a shorter-than-short skirt and a barely-buttoned blouse. Shaw grins.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: No more so than usual.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Right, just your average deadly bombing on U.S. soil during an Olympics. Happens all the time.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Pressure’s on you guys, too. CNN’s got it wall-to-wall. Might account for your shorter-than- usual skirt and your tits-ablaze blouse.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Admit it, though. I’m smoking hot! The truth? Yes, he thinks she’s smoking hot.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Give me something I can print, Tom. I’1l treat you right.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Sorry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue)

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I know the Bureau's looking at someone.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: What makes you think so?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Sources. Friends. Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: If you couldn’t fuck it out of them, what makes you think you can fuck it out of me? She smiles, wets her lips. Shaw exhales... then: Shaw hesitates. She leans in -- that open blouse.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Ya know what people don’t get, Kathy? How much work goes in to making a case. It’s effort, 24-7.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: You’re right. So educate me.

dialogues.speaker: I WON'T HAVE THIS SCREWED UP.
dialogues.text: There was a slaughter out here. It’s a miracle there weren’t more fatalities.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t run it unless I had independent corroboration from a second source. That would put us in a different zone, as you know. (her hand drifting) Tom. You’re about to burst.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: First time in my life I ever wished I was gay. Kathy smiles... then Shaw gives it up: WHOA.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: The Bureau's looking at the security guard. Jewell. Kathy freezes. Did I hear that wrong? Trying to calm herself, she takes out her notepad. 46. 59 Kathy lets her hand drop onto his lap. He’s hard as an anvil. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 60 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 47.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: You always look at the guy who found the bomb, just like you always look at the guy who found the body. But Jewell’s got a bad past. Fits the hero-bomber profile to a ‘T.’

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, shit! The fat loser living with his mother! So obvious! Why didn’t I see it?! (her mind racing) This puts a clock on things. Wanna get us a room? Or should we just go down to my car? INT./EXT. BOBI’S APT. - FRONT DOOR - NIGHT 60 Bobi opens the door to find -- Bill Miller on the doorstep -- Jewell’s GBI buddy. Bobi’s thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: It's so good to see you, Bill! It’s been a while.

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: It's nice to see you, Bobi! Where’s the hero?

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: He’s right here. Come on in! Bobi, proud as hell, welcomes him in... INT. BOBI’S APT. - DINING ROOM - NIGHT 61 They’re onto second helpings of lasagna now --

dialogues.speaker: MILLER
dialogues.text: What kinda charge ya figure it was?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Not sure what kinda explosive the guy used -- black powder, match heads, maybe some kinda chlorate, packed with nails. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 48.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Funny thing is, when those drunks moved it, they saved a bunch of lives, ‘cause it was s’posed to blow OUT, into a crowd, for maximum casualties. They left it on its BACK, so it exploded upwards, most of the ordnance going into the sky. There’s nails from it on rooftops all over downtown. You'd typically have a battery and a timing device, could even be a simple clock. I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller is in the back of a moving van, a sickened look on his face. He unbuttons his shirt and we see why: He was wearing a WIRE during that dinner. A FBI OPERATIVE removes it gently...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy glides through, stopping at Martz’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Sweetie, I need you to do one of those better-word-things you do.

dialogues.speaker: MARTZ
dialogues.text: You mean rewrite you?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Yes. You know I write like a brick. And this one’s kinda special.

dialogues.speaker: MARTZ
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing. Just the FBI is looking at Richard Jewell as the bomber... Martz’s eyes go wide. We --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Managing Editor JOHN WALTER listens as Kathy pitches him. Staffers looking on.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: ‘The security guard who first alerted police to the pipe bomb that exploded in Centennial Olympic Park is the target of the federal investigation into the incident that resulted in two deaths and injured more than 100.’ Her reading CONTINUES OVER: 65 INT. BOBI’S APT. - DAY 65 Bobi bakes a pound cake. Jewell playing a video game.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ‘Richard Jewell, 33, a former law enforcement officer, fits the profile of the lone bomber. This profile generally includes a frustrated white man who is a former police officer, member of the military, or police ‘wannabe’ who seeks to become a hero.’ 66 INT. AJC - 8TH FLOOR —- NEWSROOM - MOMENTS LATER 66 Kathy continues pitching the piece to Walter:

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: ‘Jewell has become a celebrity in the wake of the bombing, making appearances on the “Today Show” and’ --

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: -- Bureau knows you have this?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: My guy says it’s everywhere now; the networks have it. CNN has it.

dialogues.speaker: MARTZ
dialogues.text: I got a guy at GBI said the same thing. Bureau’s looking at Jewell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 67 68 69 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 50.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Then why isn’t anyone reporting it? Does anybody feel we’re getting worked here?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, John, these are OUR Olympics! If we’re not gonna lead on this story, what the fuck are we DOING here? Walter exhales hard... and decides:

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Okay. Tear up the afternoon edition and replate the front page. We’re running it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATRONS watch a big-screen TV as the STORY EXPLODES: BREAKING NEWS on CNN -- The ANCHOR holds up a copy of the AJC and reads the piece verbatim over the air.

dialogues.speaker: CNN ANCHOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (into camera) ‘The security guard who first alerted police to the pipe bomb...’ Shock on every face. People reaching for cell phones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy enters. CNN is blaring from TVs. And: Everyone in here turns... and APPLAUDS her. 100 CO- WORKERS, even the women who resent her short skirts. It's a journalism mountaintop. RESPECT FROM HER PEERS, at last. Kathy beams with humility and gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom Shaw is at work as the story breaks. Everyone around him LIVID. And Tom Shaw knows he’s a dead man. Bruce Hughes storms in, irate. Everyone turns. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 70 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 51.

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE HUGHES
dialogues.text: Who the fuck leaked this investigation to the AJC?! Of course, no one confesses. Tom Shaw eyes his shoe- tops.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Tom Shaw's eyes go wide. Instant terror. How do they know?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: BRUCE HUGHES
dialogues.text: Get Jewell in here. Non- confrontational interview. TODAY. Bennet has a tactical approach. Tom Shaw’s heart begins to beat again. He looks to Dan Bennet. We RETURN TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV OFF. Jewell sleeps. Bobi bakes more pound cakes... A firm KNOCK at the front door. Jewell awakens, rises, goes to the door... Opens it:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Hello? Shaw and Bennet stand here. Oddly, we hear HUNDREDS OF VOICES shouting from the PARKING LOT:

dialogues.speaker: VOICES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Richard! Richard! But Jewell can’t see anyone from here.

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: Richard Jewell?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: Special Agents Dan Bennet and Tom Shaw, FBI. Ya got a minute?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Sure! What can I do for you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 71 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 52.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FBI! Wow! Bobi drifts over, visible behind her son...

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Bureau’s making a training video on how to handle a suspicious package. We’d like you to be in it. How’s that sound to you?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: That sounds great!

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: See that, Richard? You did it! You showed ‘em what kinda cop you can be. And look at this now! The disembodied VOICES in the parking lot call out again. Jewell ignores them. Bennet eyes Shaw...

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Only thing is, we're shooting it today. Think you could follow us back to the field office? Time’s kinda tight.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Uh, I got work still. My shift.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: This won’t take long.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Sure. I wanna help in any way I can. I’m law enforcement, too.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: We know that. You ready to go? Jewell wearing his SECURITY SHIRT, kisses Bobi goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: So proud of you, baby! He emerges, following Shaw and Bennet down the steps, Jewell completely unaware of what’s awaiting him. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell FREEZES, shocked: 200 MEDIA MEMBERS descend, a HORDE -- cameras, mics, booms -- coming right at him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 72 73 74 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 53.

dialogues.speaker: HORDE
dialogues.text: Richard, has the FBI charged you?/ Have you hired an attorney?/Is the FBI investigating you? He’s surprised but unafraid -- pushes through, smiling:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I imagine they’1l investigate anyone who was at the park that night. That includes you all, too. He laughs it off; no one else does. Shaw and Bennet get to their SEDAN. Jewell gets to his TOYOTA PICKUP.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Course not. He gets in his truck. INT. JEWELL’S TRUCK - DAY (LATER) 72 Jewell drives. In his REARVIEW, he sees FOUR VEHICLES, trailing him. Odd. He makes a left. So do they...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters the FBI FIELD OFFICE LOT and parks. The FOUR CARS BEHIND HIM park, too. He gets out of the truck. Bennet and Shaw emerge from their car to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Sorry. I think I have some media following me.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: No. Those are our guys. Oh. Jewell nods, processing that... INT. BOBI’S APT. — SAME TIME 74 Bobi flips on the TV... and FREEZES: There’s Jewell’s PHOTO -- her baby boy -- with the words “BOMBING SUSPECT” stamped across his face. She stares, poleaxed... Then reaches for a PHONE...  75 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight, windowless. Jewell opposite Bennet and Shaw. There’s a CAMERAMAN in here, taping the interview.

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: You came back around the tower, and spotted the package unattended.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: Did you see anyone walking away from the bench?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: So, you had no idea who'd put that package there?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No, sir. But whoever did it oughtta fry.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: We think so, too, Richard. (a beat) We wanna do this authentically -- some of that has to do with how to treat a suspect. So, for this part, let’s pretend you’re someone we've brought in, okay? We've just read you your Miranda rights, and you’ve agreed to waive them. Here, here’s a waiver so it all looks real. Bennet places an ACTUAL RIGHTS WAIVER before Jewell.

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: So, you sign it, then we go on with the interview.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Okay. They hand him a pen. He pretends to sign, moving the pen through the AIR and not on the page. They pause. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75  75 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 55.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Sorry if I wasn’t clear enough, Richard. We need you to actually sign the waiver. Huh? Jewell’s internal alarms just started to ping.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: But... this is a real document...

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: Of course. We're going for authenticity here. Hold it. Jewell studies them. Some panic growing now...

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir, but I wouldn't feel right signing something like this.

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: Richard, we -- Shaw whispers something to Bennet, who nods.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: We’re gonna take a short break. Let’s stop the camera. The cameraman stops taping. The feeling is odd, creepy. Bennet and Shaw leave the room. We STAY HERE -- Jewell sits in tense silence, trying not to fidget or look guilty. Impossible.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I was a deputy sheriff. Habersham County. Cameraman is unimpressed. Jewell sags. Time stops. Then Shaw returns with a grin:
