dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Okay! We’re going to pretend none of this ever happened. (at cameraman) Let’s start a new tape, please. Cameraman pops the TAPE out of his camera, hands it to Shaw, who tosses it in a waste basket as the cameraman puts in a NEW TAPE. He nods to Shaw, “ready,” and... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 76 77 78 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 56.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: So, what we’re gonna do now is, Agent Bennet is gonna walk in and re-introduce himself to you, show you his credentials, just like we're doing a professional interview. Then he’s going to read you your Miranda rights, and --

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Um... Why would ya do that?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: To make the video more realistic. Shaw opens the door. Bennet re-enters. A feeling of make-believe in the air. We’re “rolling” again... and: Now Jewell KNOWS: They think I did this!

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Uh... I think maybe I should contact my attorney.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Why would you need an attorney? I thought you were a hero. Is there something you want to tell us?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No. I just, I better call him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A free-standing two-story building off a nondescript alley. Bryant, oblivious to the world, pulls his TOYOTA FORERUNNER into his PARKING SPACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryant climbs stairs. Drab carpet underfoot, drab walls.

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: Bryant emerges into a lifeless hallway. A door says “Law Offices of G. Watson Bryant.” He enters:  79 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 57. INT. CHILIVIS BLDG. - BRYANT’S “SUITE” -— CONTINUOUS 79

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: Nadya at her desk: livid.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: You can’t leave your phone off, Watson! TI needed to reach you!

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? She holds up this afternoon’s AJC: “FBI SUSPECTS ‘HERO’ GUARD MAY HAVE PLANTED BOMB.” Whoa. Bryant grabs the paper, scours the front page.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: He’s called you three times from an interrogation room at the FBI Field Office! Terrified.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Jesus. Am I the only lawyer that guy knows?

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: For your sake, I hope so. Bryant turns to page two. More RELATED ARTICLES: “Security Guard Had Reputation as Zealot.” “Motive? Could Be Sociopath, Attention Seeker.” And “Crimes Committed by Guards Plague Security Industry.”

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Paper says the Bureau has him dead to rights.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: In Russia when the government says someone's guilty, it’s how you know he’s innocent. Is it different here? ZERO doubt in her voice. But Bryant is wavering.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: I‘ll tear up the messages. I’m sure we’ll get another three or four cases this juicy tomorrow. And you have SO MUCH ELSE to do... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 58.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Would you connect me to the field office, Nadya?

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: Right away... She dials. He waits. She hands him the phone.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: FBI Field Office.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (grabs the phone) This is Watson Bryant, attorney for Richard Jewell. I'd like to speak to my client, please.

dialogues.speaker: FBI OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (through phone) I’m sorry, sir, we have no one here by that name.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes, you do. Put me on the phone with my client, please. Now.

dialogues.speaker: FBI OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (through phone) Please call back later, sir. Maybe we'll have more information. CLICK. And that fast, Bryant’s deep hatred for institutional bullshit has flared to life. Pure rage.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Goddammit. Nadya dials again. Bryant hears --

dialogues.speaker: FBI OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (through phone) FBI Field Office.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) This is Watson Bryant again, attorney for Richard Jewell. My next call is going to be to Mike Wallace of ‘Sixty Minutes’ to ask him why the FBI would deny a citizen his constitutional right to legal counsel. Can I have the spelling of your name, please? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 80 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 59.

dialogues.speaker: FBI OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (through phone) I’‘1l connect you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell sits. Bennet enters, hands Jewell a PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: Call for you. Jewell eagerly picks it up:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) Richard, it’s Watson. What’re you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) They said they needed me for a training film.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) They don’t! You’re a suspect. Have you signed anything? Have you confessed to anything?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Course not. I didn’t do this, Watson.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) Just don't say anything, to anyone. Let me talk to the agent in charge. Jewell hands the phone to Shaw.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: He wants to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: (into phone) This is Agent Shaw. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 60.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone) No more questions. Not another WORD.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: (into phone) He’s been cooperating fully.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: NOT ANOTHER WORD
dialogues.text: He SLAMS down the phone. END INTERCUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell’s blue Toyota pickup pulls into the lot. The MOB turns, en masse, swarming toward him. Bobi, at the window, watches helplessly through Levolors:

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JEWELL
dialogues.text: He gets out and is instantly engulfed:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I’m not a suspect. I’m nota suspect.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Richard, did you set that bomb?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No, sir. I didn’t do this. He gets to the stairs, besieged... and: He enters, whipped. Bobi looks shaken. A PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Momma, they’re all after me now. Bobi nods. The PHONE RINGS again. Jewell looks to the TV -- TOM BROKAW and BOB COSTAS, reporting. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 82 83 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 61.

dialogues.speaker: BROKAW, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on TV) They probably have enough to arrest him right now, probably enough to prosecute him, but you always want to have enough to convict him as well. There are still holes in this case. The color drains from Bobi’s face. Tears falling.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Richard, what is he saying? Why would Tom Brokaw say that about you? No reply. The PHONE rings again. It will NEVER STOP. INT./EXT. SHAW’S BUICK - PARKING LOT - SAME TIME 82 Shaw is alone in his car, windows rolled up, pounding the dashboard, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryant drives up in his 4Runner, passing NEWS VANS, TRUCKS. The MOB ignores him. He parks, makes his way through the hungry crowd, wearing his HIKING SHORTS.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: ‘Scuse me... They realize he’s on his way to the STEPS leading to Bobi’s apartment. He’s SOMEBODY! That fast, the CAMERAS are on and the MICS ARE OUT. But Bryant’s already at the door. Knocks. The door OPENS. Bryant and Jewell eye one another, 10 years on. Bryant wondering: “Am I looking at a mad bomber???” Jewell thinking: “Hiking shorts? Balding?” It’s a let-down... So Bryant tries a tension-breaker:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Ya got that hundred you owe me? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 84 85 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 62.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jewell frowns, ashamed. Lets him in. MORE QUESTIONS ARE HURLED FROM THE MOB. The closing door silences them... INT. BOBI’S APT. 84 INSIDE NOW. Jewell and Bobi study Bryant. The PHONE RINGS incessantly. Bryant pulls the cord from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: For the next little while, the only person you need to talk to is me.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Momma, this is Watson. Watson, this is my mother, Barbara. Bobi.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: He does not open his mouth again if there is a cop present, or an FBI agent, or someone from GBI, or a CROSSING GUARD. Is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Raised to respect authority, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: ‘Authority’ is what’s outside that window, looking to eat you alive. (as Jewell reacts) Let’s get to work. INT. BOBI’S APT. - 2 AM 85 Bobi sleeps. Jewell looks out the window at the MOB.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You belong to any kind of extremist groups, Richard?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Posse Comitatus, Aryan Nation, anything like that?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I hate all that stuff.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Any anti-government affiliations, or religious cults or...? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 63.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No, no. That’s not me.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Any of your friends affiliated with any fringe organizations?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Is the NRA fringe? No reply. Bryant makes sure Bobi’s asleep... Then:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Richard, this is a capital crime here. Death penalty. I can help you, but only if I know the truth. Did you do this? Jewell looks wounded by the question. Gathers himself.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No. Bryant stares right through him... Decides:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Then let’s beat the hell outta these bastards. 86 EXT. MONACO APTS. — PARKING LOT - NIGHT (LATER) 86 Bryant emerges. The horde SWALLOWS HIM:

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: ARE YOU RICHARD’S ATTORNEY?/ WHAT’S YOUR NAME, SIR?/WHAT HAS

dialogues.speaker: BOMB
dialogues.text: 87 INT. BOBI’S APT. — SAME TIME 87 Jewell plugs the phone back in. An INSTANT RING.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 88 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 64.

dialogues.speaker: ANONYMOUS CALLER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (through phone) It was a good thing, that bomb. Weren’t gonna be long before the Zionist Organizational Government comes in and starts a -- Jewell hangs up, unplugs the phone again. INT. BRYANT’S 4RUNNER — PARKED 88 Watson gets in and exhales: WHAT HAVE I JUST GOTTEN MYSELF INTO? Bryant starts to drive away, then -

dialogues.speaker: KATHY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Not quite real estate law -- is it, Mr. Bryant? Jesus. Kathy’s in his backseat, coiled like a snake.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Who the hell’re you?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I could be the best friend you'll ever have. Kathy Scruggs. AJC.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Of course. Get out.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Have you secured an actual defense attorney for Richard?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: No comment.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: See, ‘no comment’ doesn’t help me. Which means I can’t help you.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: That’s why you’re here? To help me?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Watson, I’m not sure you grasp the tank that’s about to roll over you. This is the U.S. Government --

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Want me to call the cops? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 89 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 65.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Cops love me. I tell their stories all day. Let me tell yours.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Out. Kathy eyes him. We --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. “TODAY SHOW” SET - MORNING 89 A LIVE ON-AIR INTERVIEW: Bryant and BRYANT GUMBEL. (Mixture of REAL FOOTAGE.)

dialogues.speaker: GUMBEL
dialogues.text: What do you think of the manner in which the FBI has treated your client?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I think whoever the bum was who leaked that Richard Jewell was the focus of this investigation should be prosecuted or dealt with in some serious way. I don’t think that this investigation should be, aaahhh, conducted under world spotlight like this.

dialogues.speaker: GUMBEL
dialogues.text: Why are you so convinced of his innocence?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Because I’ve known Richard for a while. I’ve looked him in the eye and I’ve asked him the question.

dialogues.speaker: GUMBEL
dialogues.text: Were you aware that he had been arrested in the past for impersonating an officer? WHOA. Deer in headlights moment. Bryant recovering.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I don’t know a lot of things about a whole lot of people that I know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 66.

dialogues.speaker: GUMBEL
dialogues.text: There are also misdemeanors on his record. And he seems to have a cabin in the woods that the police are eager to examine now.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I, uh, I have not yet conducted a thorough investigation into Richard and his history. I don’t have Richard’s police record. You may.

dialogues.speaker: GUMBEL
dialogues.text: Were you aware he’d been asked by the Habersham Sheriff's Department to seek psychological counseling?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I have not, uh, I have not yet gotten up to speed on some things, that’s all.

dialogues.speaker: GUMBEL
dialogues.text: I’1l ask you again -- why are you so convinced of his innocence?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I believe him.

dialogues.speaker: GUMBEL
dialogues.text: Pure and simple. (to the camera) Twenty-three past the hour. We’ll be right back. Bryant smiles thinly. He KNOWS that was a disaster. 90 INT. BOBI’S APT. - SAME TIME 90 Bobi and Jewell just watched that. The PHONE rings.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (through phone)

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Once. It was complicated. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 91 92 93 94 95 96 97 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 67.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (through phone)

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah, course, just, in all the hoopla yesterday I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (through phone) Goddammit, Richard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MICHAEL JOHNSON is in the blocks, about to run a 200 as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryant stands beside the SOUND AND LIGHT TOWER -- a CRIME SCENE now, ringed by a fence, metal detectors, SECURITY. He eyes the battered tower, Nadya beside him. Then:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG. Michael Johnson BURSTS out of the blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryant starts walking. To where? Nadya eyes her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Johnson is flying down the track, at the turn...

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING 9
dialogues.text: Bryant keeps walking, eyeing his watch, all business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Johnson, nearing the FINISH LINE...  98 99 100 101 102 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryant exits the park, walking briskly, Nadya beside him. Another check of his watch. Where’s he going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael Johnson BREAKS THE TAPE. The CROWD CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryant and Nadya arrive at the BANK OF NINE PAY PHONES. (The TENTH has been removed by the FBI.)

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Time.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: Six minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 200 TIME is posted. NEW WORLD RECORD. HUGE CHEER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryant eyes his watch...

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Okay. We know the second 9-1-1 call was placed at 12:58, from the PAY PHONE that had been right here. We also know Richard was inside the park near the sound and light tower at 12:57 when Bill Miller called the backpack in. He would’ve had to cover the distance in two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: Then he couldn’t’ve placed the call.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Coulda ridden a bike, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: There and back? No one noticing? Bryant coming to a grudging conclusion -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102 103 104 105 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 69.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: He actually didn’t do this. Shit. They look around -- ATLANTANS breeze down the sidewalk, confident that the bomber’s been caught. But he hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN in the FISHERMAN’S HAT who placed those pre-bomb calls emerges from his trailer and shuts the door. We don’t see his face. INT. BOBI’S APT. - MORNING 104 Bryant, holding a SEARCH WARRANT, looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40 AGENTS out there, with DOGS. A physical-evidence team, a bomb-squad team, ATF -- each with different colored shirts on. They approach the door.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO BRYANT
dialogues.text: Offended. Jewell is beside him, petrified.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You don’t talk. JI talk. They’re just gonna look around. Ya got any guns in the house? (as Jewell nods) Go get them, lay them on your bed. We don’t want any surprises. Jewell disappears. Bryant looks to Bobi. She’s shaking. INT. BOBI’S APARTMENT - JEWELL’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER WEAPONS lie on the bed. Shotguns, rifles.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Were you expecting a zombie invasion or something?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: They’re for deer. I hunt. And this is all just standard camo gear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 70.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Richard, I wanna explain something to you. Okay? All you’re guilty of right now is looking like the kind of guy who might set off a bomb. But everything you do that promotes that image is going to hang us. So -- He stops himself. Just saw sheer TERROR in Bobi’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Sorry. Poor choice of words. I just, is there anything else odd or quirky I’m going to discover today?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Kinda. I haven’t paid my taxes in two years. Bryant sighs. Bobi nervously fills the silence:

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: I hate guns. I don’t know why. My daddy loved guns; I just never did. Every time Richard goes hunting I tell him, ‘Don’t you drag a dead Bambi into this house. I am NOT eating Bambi!’ Richard can shoot, though. He scored a 98 out of 100 on his shooting test when he was a deputy with the Habersham County Sheriffs. Just then, a loud KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You don’t talk. I talk. Say it.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I don’t talk... But I want those guys to know I’m law enforcement, too. Just like them.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: See, that’s TALKING. That’s what we don’t want.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: You picked the right lawyer, Richard. Jewell nods. Bryant goes to the front door, opens it.  106 107 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 71. INT. BOBI’S APT. - FOYER/LIVING ROOM — CONTINUOUS ACTION Bennet, Shaw, and the 40 AGENTS in different-colored shirts crowd onto the landing. They file in, like a row of brightly-colored pennants, with DOGS.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: It’s like the United Goddamn Colors of Benetton.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Take everything, take the carpet. I am law enforcement, just like you. So, take whatever you’re going to take because it’s all going to prove that I didn’t do anything. Bryant shoots him a look: STOP talking. Jewell nods.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: You’re going to be counsel, Mister Bryant?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: That’s right. Bryant hands Shaw a business card, “The Law Offices of G. Watson Bryant.” Shaw eyes it, deeply unimpressed. Bennet hands Bryant a bag. Bryant takes it, angrily.

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: If you wanna stay in here, you have to put these on. INT. BOBI’S APT. - DAY (LATER) 107 Jewell, Bobi, and Bryant wear BLUE RUBBER GLOVES and RUBBER SOCKS as they sit on a couch, watching the agents tear through clothes, toiletries, food. Bryant fuming. An AGENT looks through the few BOOKS in here, stopping to peruse a VINCENT BUGLIOSI BOOK about the OJ trial.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: That's a great book. Lotta detail in it about police procedure. Agent just bags it in a Ziploc. Jewell sags. AGENT #2(Diader Rosario) comes by, toting a big CARDBOARD BOX of stuff from Jewell’s bedroom, struggling to get to the door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 107 108 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 72.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: You need a hand with that? No reply. Jewell rises to get to the door -- despite a look from Bryant. But Bennet opens it. AGENT #3(Don Johnson) eyes a case of DISNEY MOVIES on VHS.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: I use those when I babysit. Great. Each VHS gets bagged in Ziploc. Bobi tightens...

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: I think it might be better if you all just stepped out and let us do our jobs. Bryant tears off his rubber gloves and socks, stands up.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: C’mon, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: (yells) Johnson. Rosario. You find anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell and Bryant sit on the STEPS outside the door as: Every box is taken out and loaded onto trucks. Shaw supervising it all. The MOB broadcasting every step.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Ya never did tell me the name of the firm you'd moved to, Watson.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I opened my own.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Oh. How come?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Firms mean partners, and partners think they can tell you who to be. I don’t care much for being dictated to. Then they hear Bobi yelling as TWO AGENTS exit the unit, boxes in hand, down the steps. Bobi’s mad as hell. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 108 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 73.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: What’s wrong, Momma?

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: They’ve went through my under- things. How much indignity do they want us to take? She’s shaking. Bryant stands, livid, goes after them:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Hold on, fellas! The agents head for the FBI TRUCKS. Bryant bounds down the steps into the PARKING LOT in pursuit, but -- THE MOB CONSUMES HIM, instantly SURROUNDING him in a cocoon of bodies so tight that he can’t get through.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Excuse me. I need to -- No room to move at all. And the QUESTIONS come:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: No, he didn’t. He’s innocent. Richard Jewell is a HERO.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: If he’s innocent, why’s the FBI here?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: We WANT them here. We welcome this.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: No, you don’t. That landed. The MOB keeps pressing, pushing. Bryant can’t move an inch, a suffocating compression of people. Just then, Shaw emerges from the unit, sees Jewell sitting alone. That’s an opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Hey, Richard. Mind comin’ in here for a minute? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 108 109 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 74.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Sure. INT. BOBI'S APT. —- LIVING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER 109 Shaw sits on the edge of the coffee table, beside Bennet. Jewell on the sofa. Shaw grabs a TELEPHONE, dials -- it’s a moment we’ve seen before:

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Okay, Richard. I’m going to hand you this phone now... Shaw hands the PHONE to Jewell.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: When you hear a BEEP on the other end, I want you to say into it, ‘There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes.’

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, what?

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: We need a voice exemplar. Like ya to say it a few times.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: ‘There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes.’ Might be the only way to clear your name, Richard. Jewell does NOT want to do this, but they’re the law. The phone BEEPS. Jewell takes it, steels himself, then:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Good. Again, please. Louder.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: (into phone) There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Again. In fact, let’s just doa series. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109 110 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 75.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jewell considers that. Perspiring a bit. Then...

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes. There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes. (as they want more) There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes. There is a bomb in Centennial Park. You have thirty minutes. There is a -- But Bryant blows through the front door and ERUPTS:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me!

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Watson, it’s standard procedure.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (yanks phone away) The hell it is!

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Mister Bryant, we --

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Maybe you can do this, maybe you can’t. But you are NOT doing this today. Let’s go, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I really don’t mind. It’1l just clear me.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: LET’S GO. Bryant literally pulls him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hour #7. Jewell on the steps. Bryant stands. Dave Dutchess is now here. The MOB hasn’t moved. Meanwhile: -- Agents talk to NEIGHBORS. -- Agents look through the complex’s DUMPSTER and LAUNDRY ROOM. -- They trash Jewell’s once-orderly room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 111 112 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 76.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JEWELL
dialogues.text: Sitting, waiting, a sad figure. Dutchess disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: DUTCHESS
dialogues.text: Dicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell, Bryant, Dutchess, and Bobi are still here as -- AGENTS file out, boxes in hand. Here’s Shaw:

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: We're done in there. Jewell stands, turns. Looks into the parking lot: Several VANS and TRUCKS have now been loaded. Bryant heads inside. Bobi, too. Jewell follows, but -- He STOPS. A sudden tightness in his chest. Bryant turns -

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Richard? Jewell nods, but it’s unconvincing. He heads inside. INT. BOBI’S APT. - LIVING ROOM/KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER 11 The four of them sit, stunned. The place feels violated. Jewell’s room is a wreck. Bobi moves to the window. INSTANT SHUTTER CLICKS from outside. We’re CAGED. She watches as the FBI VANS drive away. Goes to the kitchen. Everything is in ZIPLOC BAGS. Flour, sugar, all bagged.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: They took all my Tupperware. What would they need with my Tupperware?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: The bomber used Tupperware to hold the nails. That’s standard.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: What’s it got to do with YOU? And why would they take all my baby- sitting tapes? My Disney movies? We hear a KNOCK at the front door. Bryant goes to it. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 77.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Probably wanna see if we'd recorded anything over the tapes -- ya know, political statements or something.

dialogues.speaker: BOBI
dialogues.text: Why’re you defending these people?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I’m not. I’m just explaining.

dialogues.speaker: BOBI
dialogues.text: Well, STOP it! She slaps the table. Jewell doesn’t fire back. Then:

dialogues.speaker: NADYA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi. They turn. Here’s Nadya, carrying a BAG OF GROCERIES.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: This is Nadya. She works with me.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: Thought you might want some dinner.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Bless your heart. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Hi. I’m Richard. Nadya smiles, well aware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HOODED FIGURE vanishes into the Carolina woods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell waits while Brandi squats to pee. A quiet moment. But 50 PRESS MEMBERS are watching him. Surreal, eerie. The dog finishes. Jewell heads back home as:

dialogues.speaker: HORDE
dialogues.text: Richard, has the FBI charged you?/ What're they saying to you?/Did you blow those people up? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 114 115 116 117 118 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 78.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I did not do this. I didn’t do this terrible thing! Then he STOPS. That sudden TIGHTNESS in his chest again. He shakes the symptoms off, keeps walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell’s belongings, bagged and tagged, fill this room. An EVIDENCE TEAM inspects two HOLLOWED-OUT GRENADES... INT. BOBI’S APT. - DAY 116 Bryant, an INVENTORY LIST in hand, stares at Jewell:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Grenades, Richard?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: They're paperweights. I bought ‘em at a military surplus store.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agents analyze Jewell’s SCRAPBOOK. Taped inside it is that tiny SLIVER FROM THE BLOWN-UP BENCH at the park... INT. BOBI’S APT. - RESUMING 118 Bryant keeps his eyes on the list --

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: A piece of the bench?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: It was a souvenir. Bobi, fed up, climbs on the sofa to take down that PORTRAIT of Jewell in his Habersham deputy sheriff's uniform.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Leave it up, Bobi. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 119 120 121 122 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 79.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Makes me sad now, thinking they’re doin’ this to one of their own. She turns up the VOLUME on the TV as we DRIFT INTO a --

dialogues.speaker: PRESS COVERAGE 119
dialogues.text: JAY LENO (ON VIDEO) -- Calling Jewell “The Una-doofus.”

dialogues.speaker: JAY LENO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ++. a scary resemblance to the guy who whacked Nancy Kerrigan. What is it about the Olympics that brings out fat, stupid guys? Big LAUGHS from the crowd. -- TIGHT ON a NEW YORK POST, calling Jewell “a fat, failed former sheriff's deputy” and “a village Rambo.” -- MORE VIDEO, MORE PRINT. A tidal wave. Jewell is a national joke. We see that land on his face as our MONTAGE BECOMES...

dialogues.speaker: DAY 120
dialogues.text: FROM ACROSS the newsroom we watch Kathy and Ron Martz type madly, like Woodward and Bernstein... Then: INSERTS: One HEADLINE after another -- burying Jewell, th FBI's case building but without any evidence. Front page after front page, IN our face, slamming loudly, then -- INT. BOBI’S APT. - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT 121 Bryant, Jewell, and Bobi sit -- dejected and silent. The place smells STALE. Feels like a PRISON... Bryant looks out the window: The HORDE is out there, as always. So are FIVE FBI SEDANS. Jewell turns a BASEBALL GAME up loud. Things are feeling a little CRAZY in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell pays at the counter. TWO GUYS behind him in line stare: That’s HIM! Jewell can feel their excitement. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 122 123 124 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 80.

dialogues.speaker: DONUT BUYER
dialogues.text: Now, you ain’t gonna blow us up, are ya? No reply from Jewell, just a wounded smile. He gets his change, takes away TWO BAGS, and exits.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell emerges. Bryant waits here, in Jewell’s PICKUP. So do FIVE FBI SEDANS. Oddly, Jewell heads for one of them -- the one that Shaw is in. Bryant tightens: What’s Jewell doing? Jewell taps on the sedan window. Shaw rolls the window down. What the??? --- as Jewell hands over one of the two bags of donuts.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Thought you guys might be hungry.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Uh... we can’t accept these. Across the street, 100 PHOTOGRAPHERS CAPTURE IT ALL...

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: It’s not a bribe or anything. I just know stakeouts suck.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Would you take them, please? Disappointed, Jewell collects the bag and walks away. INT. JEWELL’S PICKUP — CONTINUOUS ACTION 124 Jewell gets in. Bryant livid.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: It’s a cop thing.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: A: You don’t need any more donuts. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 81.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sick of everyone calling you fat. B: You don’t need any more attention.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: You never done a stakeout.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Richard, you just gave the world a headline: ‘Jewell Tries to Buy Off Cops with Donuts!’ I can’t help you if you’re gonna let them make a joke out of you.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Thought if the cops liked me more, they might not be so hard on us. Bryant freezes. That felt so sad and heartbreaking...

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: They’re NEVER gonna like you. Let’s just get ‘em to respect you. Okay? He opens Jewell’s GLOVE COMPARTMENT to stuff the bag in - ... which is when Bryant sees a small TEDDY BEAR inside. Huh? Bryant just stares, then extracts the Teddy bear.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Oh. I used to work a lot of car wrecks when I was in the sheriff's office. Sometimes there'd be kids involved, and they’d always be scared. So, I kept Teddy bears in my trunk, to calm ‘em down. Just became a habit. There it is -- Jewell’s pure, innocent kindness again. And Bryant is ashamed, feeling like a major asshole.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Never know when you’re gonna happen upon a car wreck, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No, sir. Bryant puts the bear away, shuts the glove compartment. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 124 125 126 127 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 82.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Let’s keep this between us, so they don’t accuse you of being a child molester. Jewell starts up the truck, pulls out -- right past Shaw. Bryant tosses the DONUTS into Shaw’s window.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Live a little. We LEAVE the lot. The FIVE FBI CARS follow. Infuriating. INT. BOBI’S APT. - LIVING ROOM - DUSK (MINUTES LATER) 125 Bobi watches TV. Bryant enters without a knock, RESOLVED.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Get up, Bobi. I’m taking you two to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Where’s Richard?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: In the car. I can’t sit in this apartment anymore. Let’s go. INT. BRYANT’S 4RUNNER (MOVING) - EVENING 126 Bryant drives. Bobi rides up front, Jewell in back. Those same FIVE FBI SEDANS trail behind. He pulls into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIVE SEDANS are forced to follow. Bobi looks around.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Watson, where’re we goin’?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You just sit tight, Bobi. She shrugs. Bryant makes a SWOOPING LEFT. Huh? --.- and all the FBI SEDANS follow. He makes a SWOOPING RIGHT now. Bobi and Jewell confused - (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 128 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 83.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But all the sedans follow... And now we get it. He’s just fucking with them. Bryant drives a little faster. They have to follow suit.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Oh, my Lord... +.. we watch as Bryant drives in a big CIRCLE, until he’s actually behind the sedans. Bobi starts to laugh, waving at the sedans -- all these agents trying to do surveillance, hopelessly fouled now.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: You see that, Richard?! And Jewell laughs, his first bright moment in a while. Bryant beaming, driving the sedans in circles... INT. BLIND WILLIE’S - NIGHT (LATER) 128 A JAPANESE MAN stands on a small stage, mic in hand, singing a KARAOKE version of “Rebel Yell.” Pretty awful. But Jewell, Bobi, and Bryant have finally found a place to be unrecognized.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I like it in here, Watson.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: I like how you handle yourself generally, Watson. Ain’t afraid of them agents, that’s fer sure. A WAITER brings a cocktail for Bryant. Beer for Bobi. Coca-Cola for Jewell. They half-toast to one another...

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: We lucked out, karaoke night.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: You know, Richard can sing.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: That right?

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Sure can.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Momma... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 84.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: What? He sang all the time when he was young. And he was good. “Rebel Yell” ends. Polite applause. The stage is empty.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Why don’t you show him, Richard?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I don’t think I should...

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Why not? You’re certainly good enough for this establishment.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I had enough attention lately. Court of public opinion and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: I don’t see any cameras, do you? Please? For me?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Momma...

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: You won't get up there and sing for your gray-haired momma like you did in school? Jewell tightens, weighing it. Bryant eyeing him... Then:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Let’s hear it, son. That surprised Jewell -- kind of surprised Bryant, too.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Really? (as Bryant nods) Awright, then. He rises, unaware that -- Kathy just drifted in, without fanfare. She lingers by the bar, out of Jewell’s eye-line as -- He gets up on stage. This has to go badly, right? He picks a song, grabs the microphone. NO ONE recognizing him. The song starts. Bon Jovi. Jewell air-guitars... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 128 129 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 85.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The first strains of “Wanted Dead Or Alive.” Then --

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: It’s all the same/Only the names have changed -- Guess what? He’s great. Bryant can’t believe it. Thrilled. Kathy’s kind of shocked, too. Bobi puffs up a bit: See? Around them, PEOPLE start to notice the guy on stage, pouring his heart out: Richard Jewell, singing Bon Jovi to the dive bar. Their heads sway to the beat. Kathy, despite herself, just started to rethink things... A GUY at the next table (Japanese-American, wears a suit, call him KEN) leans over to Bryant:

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: That guy is really good.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: And he’s a dead ringer for Richard Jewell! Bobi nearly gasps, but:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Yeah. He gets that a lot. Ken CHEERS LOUDER, as:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: ‘Cause I’m a cowboy/On a steel horse I ride/I’m wanted/Dead or alive... INT./EXT. BRYANT’S CAR/MONACO APTS. - PARKING LOT - NIGHT Bryant pulls up in front of the building. The HORDE awaits out here, like sharks...

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Thanks, Watson.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: G'night, you two. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 86.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A beat. Jewell doesn’t want to get out. Truth is, something shifted tonight. Bobi can see it.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: We're lucky to have you, Watson. And I don’t just mean that legally.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Mom --

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: No. I’m gonna say it. Richard never had a man around to look out for him. His daddy wasn’t worth a pitcher of warm spit, that’s for sure. Walked right out on us.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Listen, I’m just trying to get my hundred bucks back.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: And then he had a step-daddy who I thought might be a good man and father, but HE up and left us, too. Ain’t no man ever stood up for him. It’s why Richard wanted to be a cop -- to take care of people, ‘cause he knew what being forgotten about felt like. And now here you are, taking on all this for him. It touches me, Watson. Bryant nods... looks at the HORDE out there... and says something that’s been on his mind for too long:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Richard... We have to get you a proper defense attorney. Huh? That hovers. Jewell eyes Bobi...

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna do that.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: This is out of my league. You know that. A month ago I was doing real estate closings.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: You’re the only one I trust. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 87.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Well, I don’t always trust cops, but sometimes I NEED one. And right now you need a defense attorney who specializes in capital crimes. Preferably from a small firm that the Bureau respects. That’s not me.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: It’s not me, either.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Listen, Goddammit --

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I’m not walkin’ into court with a team of lawyers behind me like O.J. That makes people think you did it! .-. which is when his voice breaks. He stops short... +... WILL NOT LET HIMSELF CRY. But it’s close. And Bryant is stopped cold. This argument just ended.

dialogues.speaker: BOBI
dialogues.text: We should get inside.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Night, you two. They get out. Bryant watches them go. The MOB descends, instantly suffocating Jewell and Bobi. Jewell grabs her hand, plowing through the bodies -- Bryant looks sickened. He gets out of his car, SHOUTS:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You’re killing him! Every Goddamn one of you KILLING A PERSON. Aren’t you ashamed of yourselves? No one in the mob replies. But Jewell and Bobi appreciated it. They make it safely into their apartment. Door shuts. The mob dissipates. Bryant gets back in his car, pulling out of the lot, then onto Buford Highway...  130 131 132 133 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy, eyeing her watch, begins to walk -- FAST -- from the site of the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kathy arrives at the SIX PAY-PHONES and eyes her watch. Just realized the same thing Bryant did: The math doesn’t work. Jewell couldn’t have done it. Oh. INT. BOBI’S APT. - FRONT DOOR - DAY 132 The door opens. Here’s Bryant, with more bad news:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: They want your hair now. And your palm prints, the damn bastards. Jewell sags. Bobi’s not around. We --

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BOBI’S APT. - DAY (LATER) 133 Jewell sits while HAIR STRANDS are plucked from his head by a uniformed MEDIC in gloves. One at a time. Bryant watches, fuming. Bennet and Shaw supervise. TV on.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: 25 pulled, 25 combed. Medic nods. Bryant looks like he might kill somebody.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I want you to know, you might have a warrant for this -- but if you wanted to do this to me you’d have to fight me. You’d have to beat the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Not too lawyerly, Counselor. Today's AJC sits on the table. Its HEADLINE: “Jewell Kept Souvenirs of the Bomb in Mother’s Apartment.” On that TV, over a PICTURE OF JEWELL -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 133 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 89.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (on TV) The guy was seen with a homemade BOMB at his home a few days before! Bryant angrily shuts the TV OFF.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Let’s just get this over with before my mom comes home. I wouldn’t want her seein’ this. Bryant crosses to that framed PORTRAIT of Jewell in his HABERSHAM COUNTY DEPUTY SHERIFF’S UNIFORM. He adjusts the frame as if it had been askew, to call their attention to it.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Tell me, Richard, you still proud to be law enforcement?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I just wish I’d done my job better that night. I wish I’d gotten everybody far enough away. Maybe if I had, I wouldn’t be sitting here right now. Bryant eyes Shaw and Bennet.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You’re right. He’s a monster. Have you dummies done the math yet on the call from the pay phone?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Fuck the pay phone. My clients are the people who were in that park. And they deserved not to have their fucking heads blown off.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I actually feel sorry for you guys. When the real bomber does it again, and the country asks, ‘Where was the FBI?’ You’re gonna say, ‘We were busy getting hair samples from Richard Jewell’?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaw doesn’t reply.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: I’m done here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 90.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Good. (a beat) Thanks for the professional courtesy, Richard. Ya know, one cop to another.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: There’s the door. They leave. Medic follows. Bryant steaming.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: We need to start being a little less solicitous and a lot more righteous with these bastards.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: It's just hairs. They’1ll grow back.

dialogues.speaker: WHY DOESN'T THIS SHIT MAKE YOU AS
dialogues.text: ANGRY AS IT MAKES ME Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Just ‘cause someone’s not yelling doesn’t mean they’re not angry.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You’re angry?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Course.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Then stop being such a doormat! Stop tryin’ to be their best friend! I’m tired of it.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I’m tired of stuff, too!

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Yeah? Like what? (as Jewell’s silent) Like what? Jewell walks into the kitchen, leaving Bryant alone. We hear a CABINET opening. Bryant calls out:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You reach for a cookie right now and I’m gonna KILL someone! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 133 134 135 136 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 91.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We hear the cabinet close. INT. BOBI’S APT. - KITCHEN - CONTINUOUS ACTION 134 The DOORBELL RINGS. Bryant crosses to it, opens it.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: What. Nadya stands here. On the doorstep. Grim as hell.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: What’s wro-- She covers his mouth, urgently.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: Sssssshhhh. She steps INSIDE. Bryant at a loss. Jewell appearing. Nadya shuts the door and holds up a NOTE: “Our office is bugged -- in the ceiling. Our phones are also bugged. THIS PLACE IS PROBABLY BUGGED TOO.” Bryant and Jewell just stare. Jewell whispers:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: How can they keep doin’ this, Watson?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: That's easy. They can do it because you don’t matter. That felt ugly but true, and it hangs there. cUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSING CEREMONIES. America bidding farewell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This huge space, EMPTY now. Just a meager clean-up crew.  137 138 139 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. The games are a memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty. No more sound and light tower. No sign of the crime. But a space is being measured for a SCULPTURE to commemorate the tragedy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaw sits alone, getting hammered. Then -- Kathy appears, takes the barstool beside him. Shaw’s expression instantly hardens into cold contempt. Kathy signals to the bartender for Shaw’s drink to be refilled. Shaw doesn’t react.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: I can’t fucking believe you’d have the nerve to sit here.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Jewell couldn’t’ve placed the call. (as Shaw glares) The math is wrong. I tried to cover the distance between the site and the pay phones; he couldn’t’ve --

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: We know that.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: You know that?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Just means he had an accomplice.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: An accomplice.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Sure. Why not?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: The ‘Lone Bomber’ profile. The wannabe cop. With an accomplice? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 139 140 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 93.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: First, profiles are a jumping-off point. And Oklahoma City had two bombers, remember?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: So who is it?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Right. I’m gonna tell you. After you burned me like that.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Fine. I’11l just write that the case against Jewell is starting to weaken. Bad facts, et cetera.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Where did you get this idea that I work for you? Or that we work together? In fact, I don’t know why I’m even talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: (knowing grin) I know why. He gets up to go, leaving his Scotch on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Whoa. Never saw you leave one un- finished before.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: It's yours. Choke on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The feeling is foggy -- a MEMORY... or a DREAM -- We’re outside the SOUND AND LIGHT TOWER, one minute before that ALICE PACK will explode. COPS move people away. Confusion and urgency. SOUND dipping in and out.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: He’s looking at all these COPS and BYSTANDERS, who are about to be injured. There’s Alice Hawthorne, who is about to die. And Jewell knows it... So: He crawls under that bench and pulls the ALICE pack into him, wrapping himself around it like a human bomb blanket. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 140 141 142 143 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 94,

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He knows what’s coming -- a hero’s death. Shuts his eyes, can hear the bag TICKING... 5, 4, 3, 2, 1... Then: It EXPLODES. An electric white LIGHT. Jewell literally coming apart in an eruption of violence and sound as -- INT. BOBI’S APT. -— JEWELL’S BEDROOM - NIGHT (REALITY) 14 Jewell’s eyes slam open... We --

dialogues.speaker: INT. FAST FOOD PLACE
dialogues.text: Dave Dutchess eats a burger, all alone... until: Bennet and Shaw plant themselves opposite him, badges out. Quite an unpleasant surprise. Dutchess tightens.

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: Mister Dutchess. Ya got a minute? Dutchess sighs. We hear the beginnings of a HELICOPTER SOUND and MATCH THAT SOUND TO: INT. BOBI’S APT. - NIGHT (LATE) 143 On TV: a WWII movie. John Wayne. Muted. Outside, we hear a HELICOPTER hovering. Dutchess is here, opposite Jewell, Bobi, and Bryant. A feeling of shock and gloom hanging. And this is whispered:

dialogues.speaker: DUTCHESS
dialogues.text: -.. They’ve decided that since you couldn’t have placed the 9-1-1 call, you must’ve had a partner. They think that partner must be your homosexual boyfriend... which they’ve decided is probably me. That lands on the faces of everyone...

dialogues.speaker: DUTCHESS
dialogues.text: And they asked me to wear a wire.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Richard.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Sorry, ma’am. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 95.

dialogues.speaker: DUTCHESS
dialogues.text: I told ‘em to shove it. I said you were a hero. They said, ‘If he’s really a hero, then he has nothing to worry about and neither do you.’ Also said one of your GBI buddies -- the one you made lasagna for when he came over -- he was wired, too. Got a LOT on you. That hurt Jewell deeply. He’s silent. Dutchess goes on:

dialogues.speaker: DUTCHESS
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Um... There’s one other thing: They asked me if I’d ever had any experience with pipe bombs... I had to tell ‘em the truth. Bryant shuts his eyes without meaning to...

dialogues.speaker: DUTCHESS
dialogues.text: Ya know, little ones. We used to drop ‘em down groundhog holes when I was a kid in West Virginia.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: David. My Lord...

dialogues.speaker: DUTCHESS
dialogues.text: I told ‘em this was years before I even met Richard. I said ita couple times. Still... I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: It’s okay. But it’s not okay. They all know it. Outside, the sound of that HELICOPTER grows louder, closer... Bobi, depressed as hell, returns to the TV and UN-MUTES it. The sounds of a MOVIE BATTLE fill the room: WWII MORTAR ROUNDS and GUNFIRE erupting. But instantly --

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Mom! Jewell LEAPS for the remote, turns the TV off.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: How’s it gonna look if we’re in here watching movies about things blowing up?! Don’t you know they’re LISTENING! ? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 143 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 96.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's Bobi’s breaking point. She cries, runs to her room, slams the door. Jewell hurries over, gets there, knocks. Tries the handle. It’s locked. That HELICOPTER hovers.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Mom? I’m sorry. C’mon out. We can watch whatever you want. We hear Bobi’s sobs through the door. Jewell sinking.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Mom, please? Don’t stay in there. C’mon out. I won’t say nothin’ again. Please... Bryant and Nadya are left on the sofa, watching. Jewell keeps knocking on Bobi’s door --

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Momma, please. Whatever you want -- Bobi opens the door, her eyes wet. The room goes SILENT, save for the sound of that Goddamn HELICOPTER overhead...

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Richard, I’m scared.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Me, too, Momma.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: I don’t know how to protect you from these people... He grabs her and hangs on. Bobi crying. Bryant and Nadya are across the room. Jewell eyes them, while still embracing his mother:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Three days, Watson. She’s had THREE DAYS to be proud of her son in her whole life. Now this. It ain’t right.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Then are you ready to start fighting back? Jewell nods. Yes, he’s ready. Not a small moment.  144 145 146 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 97. EXT./INT. CHILIVIS BLDG./BRYANT’S 4RUNNER - MORNING 144 This normally dead street is PACKED with PRESS today. Bryant drives Jewell into the driveway/alley of this building, his truck pushing the MOB aside as he smiles warmly for the cameras. Instantly, Nadya (in her car) and Dave Dutchess (in his) pull their cars NOSE-TO-NOSE in front of the alley, blockading it behind Bryant’s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An odd, musty feel. Medieval TAPESTRIES hang on the wall. The shades are down because the MOB is right outside, in the alley -- so the room is sunless. Jewell sits, scared, as he’s wired by RICHARD RACKLEFF (50s, stocky, an FBI lifer, private sector now.)

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Don’t see why we can’t just let the FBI do this.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You'd trust them with the results? Bryant opens the shades, waves out the window.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Who ya wavin’ to?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: My new friends. An FBI VAN WITH BUBBLE-WINDOWS sits across the street.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Oh... Jewell’s anxiety RISES. Rackleff looks to Bryant: Get lost. Bryant eyes Jewell... then leaves. We --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The polygraph. The pressure cuffs. The needle. And:

dialogues.speaker: RACKLEFF
dialogues.text: Richard, whose idea was it for you to take a polygraph test? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 146 147 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 98.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Watson’s. Jewell’s sweating. Rackleff eyes the readout.

dialogues.speaker: RACKLEFF
dialogues.text: How do you think you'll do on it?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: RACKLEFF
dialogues.text: Do you know who put that bomb in Olympic Park? Bang. Their eyes meet. Jewell gulps. INT. BRYANT’S OFFICE - AN HOUR LATER 147 Nadya rests on the couch. Bryant looks out the WINDOW at that BUBBLE-WINDOW VAN and the MOB loitering outside.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Can you make some more of those pirozhkis? They were good.

dialogues.speaker: NADYA
dialogues.text: Careful, Watson. In Russia if a woman makes pirozhkis twice for a man, it means they’re engaged. He grins. Rackleff enters, looking grim. Bryant springs toward him, motioning for him to be QUIET, pointing to the ceiling and indicating, “BUGS.” Rackleff nods, leans in, and WHISPERS:

dialogues.speaker: RACKLEFF
dialogues.text: Your boy is tanking. Hard. Bryant’s eyes widen. Nadya’s, too. Bryant WHISPERS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: RACKLEFF
dialogues.text: His pulse, respiration, and skin conductivity are all off the charts -- all pointing to massive deception. And guilt. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 147 148 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 99.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (oh, fuck) I. Uh...

dialogues.speaker: RACKLEFF
dialogues.text: Looks to be in the throes of an anxiety attack. Think you could calm him down a little?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DONUT sits on a plate. Jewell, still wired-up, eyes it. Bryant beside him.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: That mean I’m doin’ bad?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You’re doing fine. He thinks your blood sugar’s low. Eat it. Jewell bites into the donut, his eyes shutting.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Can I tell you something, Richard? (as Jewell shrugs) I went to Episcopal school as a kid. When I was in first grade, two nuns accused me of writing something unholy on my desk -- Jewell’s wondering: Why is he telling me this?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I hadn't done it, but they were sure I had. So they sent me back to kindergarten for a week -- just to humiliate me; then they asked me if I’d learned my lesson. I said I hadn’t because I hadn’t written on the desk in the first place. They asked me how I’d like to go sit in kindergarten for TWO weeks. I said, ‘You can throw me in there for a year -- I still can’t apologize for writing on the desk because I DIDN’T DO IT.’

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: You said that to nuns? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 148 149 150 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 100.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I did. And they backed off. (re: FBI agents) Power doesn’t make a person right. Just tell your story, okay? Jewell nods, ready. INT. BRYANT’S OFFICE - 4 HOURS LATER - DAY 149 Bryant and Nadya sleep on the couch. Rackleff enters after a 4-HOUR test, exhausted. Nadya bolts up. Bryant waits, afraid to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: (re: ceiling bugs) Maybe we should talk somewhere el--

dialogues.speaker: RACKLEFF
dialogues.text: He passed, highest level. ‘No deception indicated.’ Bryant wants to SHOUT or jump up and down. WE CAN WIN THIS THING. But he remains calm.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Thank you. Jewell appears, over Rackleff’s shoulder. Equally exhausted. Bryant eyes him. A shared moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place thrums. Kathy at her desk. Martz walks by:

dialogues.speaker: MARTZ
dialogues.text: Anything interesting?

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Gangland murder. Fucking yawn. Martz smiles, moves on. Kathy typing away, when --

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi, Kathy. She looks up. And her eyes go wide -- because: HERE ARE BRYANT AND JEWELL. In the lions’ den. It comes to a halt. SILENCE. Kathy bracing herself -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 101.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: It was a souvenir from the bombing. Not the bomb. I said that when you asked for a quote.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: I know. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: And who are you to make fun of a guy for staying with his mother? She was going to have SURGERY; he wanted to help her out. What’s weird about that? Tell him. (off no reply) While you’re at it you can tell him how he ‘approached this newspaper seeking publicity for his actions.’ Which he didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: That was added during editorial.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Or how he fits the lone-bomber profile to a T, a ‘wannabe’ seeking to become a hero, when all he did was actually SAVE LIVES. Go ahead. We’ve got all day.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: It was a mistake. I’m human.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: So's Richard. With that, Bryant and Jewell head out. Kathy’s silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobi stands at a bank of microphones in a ballroom full of REPORTERS AND CAMERAS, Bryant just a few feet away as:

dialogues.speaker: BOBI
dialogues.text: I am so very drained. I hope and pray to God that this never happens to anybody else. I do not think any of you can even begin to imagine what our lives are like. Shutters clicking, tape rolling. She goes on: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 151 152 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 102.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: They have taken all privacy from us. They have taken all peace. They watch and photograph everything we do. And why? Because my son did his job, because he saved people. Bobi looks to her side: Bryant, encouraging her...

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: I am asking the President for help today. Mister President, my son is a hero. I think the FBI knows that by now; the evidence makes it plain. If they do not intend to charge my son, please tell us. Please tell the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobi has one more sentence to get through. And it is --

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Mister President, please clear my son’s name... And she loses it, breaking down in sobs, on camera. Bryant steps up, gently guiding her off the podium...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bobi is a wreck. Bryant leads her into a large KITCHEN -- Jewell has been waiting here among BUSBOYS and CHEFS. Bobi falls into his arms, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Momma, it’s awright...

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: I don’t know what happened. I thought I didn’t have any more tears left. Was that okay, Watson? Jewell and Bobi turn, and their jaws drop a bit because: Bryant’s eyes are wet, too. It shocks him as much as it shocks them. BUSBOYS watch. He gathers himself, then:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: This all has to end now, Richard. I mean really end. You know that. (as Jewell nods) I’m calling the FBI. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Ya see? That’s what I’m talkin’ about. He just ain’t afraid of nobody.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: You should hear what he says to nuns, Momma. Bryant studies Jewell -- a long beat -- then:

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Let’s go show ‘em who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AMERICAN FLAGS and American power. OCTOBER 6, 1996. INT. BOBI’S APT. —- SAME TIME — MORNING 154 Jewell stands at a mirror, putting on a tie. Big day. INT. BRYANT’S OFFICE - SAME TIME - MORNING 155 Bryant knots a tie, too. Definitely the best-looking suit we've seen him in yet. Very lawyerly. Nadya is at the desk, methodically packing all his FILES into a briefcase for him. Somber, but confident. Their eyes meet -- pure gratitude from Bryant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryant’s 4 Runner pulls up. Jewell and Bryant emerge, in suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell signs in, Bryant behind him. A SECURITY GUARD (old, black) waves them through a METAL DETECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell and Bryant exit an elevator, led by Agent Bennet down a hallway to chairs outside a CONFERENCE ROOM door.

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: We'll be right with you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 158 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 104.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Agent Bennet enters the conference room, leaving Jewell and Bryant alone in this quiet corridor. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: They’re going to ask to see me first. To set the ground rules.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I want them to know I’m not gay.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Believe me, you’ll get the chance to tell them. Shaw passes by, staring right through them before vanishing into the conference room. Jewell eyes the floor. Then a SOUND. He turns: It's an OFFICE CLERK... pushing a SUPPLY CART BY us. Pens, Scotch Tape, etc. Jewell watches him go, memories swirling. Bryant, too.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: See if he’s got any Snickers bars, will ya? Jewell almost laughs. Almost.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: You know what a 1001 is, Richard?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Lying to a federal agent.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: It's a felony. You say anything in there that isn’t true, they can put you in jail without ever proving you're a bomber. So if you don’t know what to say, you say nothing. You ask for a five- minute break, you consult with me. But you do not improvise. Got it? Jewell nods. Bennet leans out of the conference room --

dialogues.speaker: BENNET
dialogues.text: Mister Bryant? Bryant eyes Jewell: We've got this. Then ducks into:  159 160 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windowless and lined with EVIDENCE: An actual BENCH from outside the tower, the actual PAY PHONE from the 9-1-1 call, aerial photos of Centennial Park. And: Shaw, Bennet, and Bruce Hughes -- at a table.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Who does your decorating? Ted Kaczynski? A small jab, but it made Bryant feel better. RETURN TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell sits, eyeing that Guy pushing the SUPPLY CART. SUPPLY CART GUY comes to a door, opens it, disappears inside, leaving his CART in the hallway. Jewell rises, without even knowing why, and drifts toward the cart, down the hall... Just about to reach it when... DOOR OPENS. SUPPLY CART GUY emerging. Their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: SUPPLY CART GUY
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No, I just... Supply Cart Guy vanishes down the hall with his wares. Jewell returns to his seat, just as -- The CONFERENCE ROOM DOOR OPENS. Bryant emerges.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I mean ready -- to look at these guys not as suspect to agent but as cop to cop. Don’t give them any more deference than they’re due, Richard. They don’t deserve it. And DON’T keep calling them ‘sir.’ (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 160 161 162 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 106.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: They're still the U.S. Government.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: No. They aren’t the U.S. Government. They’re just three pricks who WORK for the U.S. Government. Understand the difference? Nobody in that room is a better man than you, Richard. Believe me. (as that landed) You'll be fine. A father-son moment. It got through. Jewell rises.

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: Jewell enters. His accusers await. We --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell has been in here for hours, flanked by Bryant.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Richard, have you ever accessed an Internet site called Candyman’s Candyland for information about The Anarchist’s Cookbook?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No, I have not.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: But you did have police training in handling explosives.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: We've covered this.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Did you ever collect any pieces of pipe from Centennial Park when it was under construction?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No, I did not. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 107.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Did you ever tell anyone in that park, ‘Take my picture now, ‘cause one day I’m going to be famous’?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No, sir. (as Bryant eyes him) No, I did not.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Sure about that?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Hundred percent.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Did you ever tell anyone that you were on your way to Atlanta and ‘It’s gonna be a mess out there’?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I meant the traffic jams.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Was there a specific reason you asked to be stationed at the sound and light tower?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I liked listening to the music. The night before, I’d had my mom come out to hear Kenny Rogers. Also, it was a great place to look at girls. I am not a homosexual.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: You and David Dutchess are not lovers?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Asked and answered.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Richard, you said earlier that on the night of the explosion, as you were moving from the tower to the stage and back again, you did not have a fix on the time. Is that right? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 162 163 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 108.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: When you have the runs -- excuse me -- you’re not thinking about what time it is. You’re just trying to get to a bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: So you can’t say exactly when you saw those drunks throwing the beer cans at the tower.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Or when you first saw the backpack?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: That’s correct.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Had you ever seen a backpack like that before?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I suppose so.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Had you ever seen that particular backpack before?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Asked and answered. Can we move on?

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Richard, did you conspire with David Dutchess or anyone else to plant a bomb at Centennial Park? Jewell sags. We PUSH IN ON him, his eyes shut, as --

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: His MEMORY: the moment of the BLAST. Death in SLOW MOTION. Green down. Other COPS down. Alice Hawthorne dead. Fallon shrieking. Blood, smoke... Then --

dialogues.speaker: CUT BACK TO
dialogues.text: RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PRESENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell opens his eyes. Bryant stepping in for him --

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Then how the fuck did you know to be behind that AT&T Tower at exactly the right moment so it’d protect you from the explosion? Jewell’s knocked back. Shaw eyes him, venomous.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Cops flying into the air. I was one of ‘em. And you come out without a scratch. How is that?

dialogues.speaker: HOW IS THAT
dialogues.text: If Jewell is going to buckle, now is the moment... But:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Can I ask you fellas something: Do you have any kind of actual CASE against me? That surprised EVERYONE -- Bryant, the feds. But -- --. It’s time to speak truth to power, at last:

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I mean evidence. Was there anything in my mother’s Tupperware? Any bomb-making materials in her apartment?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Richard, you don’t need to volunteer anything here. Let’s let them ask the --

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: -- I used to think federal law enforcement was just about the highest calling a person could aspire to. But I hafta say, I don’t anymore. Not after all this. Bryant just decided to let Jewell go... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 164 165 166 167 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 110.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: I did my job that night. Some people are alive right now ‘cause of that. But the next time some security guard sees a suspicious package somewhere, ya think he’s gonna call it in? I doubt it. He’s gonna say to himself, ‘I don’t wanna be another Richard Jewell. So I’m just gonna run.’ And how’s that make anybody any safer? (as no one replies) You-all can keep followin’ me; I guess I can stand it. But every second you spend on me is time you aren’t on the guy who actually DID it. And like Watson said, what happens when he does it again? (as again, no answer) So, are you gonna charge me with anything? Can you? The truth? No. They can’t. They don’t have anything.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Then I’m gonna go now. He rises, heads for the door. Bryant smiles proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell and Bryant climb in. The doors shut. Bryant is near tears with pride. Jewell, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaw sits alone. Done. And he knows it. EXT. MONACO APTS. - BOBI’'S FRONT DOOR - DAY (LATER) 167 Bryant walks Jewell to the door. Knocks. Bobi opens up, studies their faces for a clue... a sign.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: How'd you do? Bryant’s about to answer but the words sputter a bit -- there’s some surprising emotion behind them. Then: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 167 168 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 111.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: He did great. Bobi wraps her boy in a hug. Bryant smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell and Bryant sit, not eating, both tense. People recognize Jewell, but no one meets his eye. Shaw enters the coffee shop, spots them, heads over.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: Agent Shaw. Barely acknowledging Jewell at all, Shaw extracts a letter from a briefcase, handing it to Bryant --

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: What's this? Shaw nods, “Read it.” Bryant does so. Two paragraphs -- Beginning with: “Your client is no longer a suspect in the investigation of...”

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I’m assuming you'll be announcing this to all the major news outlets -- Tom Brokaw and the like.

dialogues.speaker: SHAW
dialogues.text: Mr. Bryant, I still think your client is guilty as hell. No reply. Shaw goes. Jewell is silent.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: So... It’s over? Really over?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
