dialogues.text: Over. You won, Richard. And it all hits -- hard. The MONTHS of wounds, tension, grief. Jewell tries not to cry, but it’s impossible -- his head drops. A BIG SOB spills out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 168 169 170 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 112.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bryant takes his hand. Jewell keeps crying. He grabs at that letter, pulls it close. We LEAVE them here... INT. BOBI’S APT. - SAME TIME 169 Bobi opens the door to find 20 FBI GUYS standing here, with CARDBOARD BOXES.

dialogues.speaker: BOBIL
dialogues.text: Oh. In they come, bearing her returned belongings. BOXES, left in the middle of the room. Bobi opens a box. All her TUPPERWARE inside. Each piece has NUMBERS on it now, in black marker. She sighs. We FIND that PORTRAIT on the wall -- Jewell in the uniform of the HABERSHAM COUNTY POLICE. Then we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell is in uniform again -- now as a Luthersville, Ga. POLICE OFFICER. He’s at a table, cataloguing evidence. ANOTHER COP passes by:

dialogues.speaker: OTHER LUTHERSVILLE COP
dialogues.text: I’m goin’ to the diner, Richard. You want anythin’?

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Naah. Brought my own. Thanks. Other Cop smiles, goes. Jewell is “one of the guys” around here. Respected. That feels pretty great. As he continues to work, we --

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: “Richard Jewell served with distinction in the Luthersville, Ga. Police Department.” “He brought lawsuits against Piedmont College, NBC, the New York Post, and CNN -- winning settlements from each.” Just then, he looks up to find BRYANT standing here.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Hey, Watson! How you doin’? How's Nadya? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 170 171 172 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 113.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: They found him, Richard. (as Jewell’s a blank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric Rudolph -- just confessed to planting the bomb at Centennial Park. SILENCE. It takes a second for that to land -- every other COP in here looking to Jewell now... But Jewell doesn’t react. Just can’t.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: When’s he being arraigned?

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Find out, okay? Bryant nods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell and Bryant emerge from a COURTROOM. THROUGH a door behind them we see a man (ERIC RUDOLPH) in an ORANGE JUMPSUIT being led away. We --

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: “The real bomber, Eric Rudolph, was captured and sentenced to four life sentences on domestic terrorism charges -- including the bombing at Centennial Park.” The courtroom door closes. Bryant and Jewell head down this corridor toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: “Kathy Scruggs died at the age of 42. Medical examiners were unable to confirm if the cause had been intentional or accidental. Agent Tom Shaw died a year and a half later of a heart attack, still convinced of Richard Jewell’s guilt.” Jewell and Bryant enter the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jewell and Bryant descend in silence... until: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 172 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 114.

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: Oh. Almost forgot. This is for you. Jewell hands Bryant an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: BRYANT
dialogues.text: What is it? Jewell shrugs, “Open it.” Bryant opens it: Inside, a 100-dollar bill. Bryant grins...

dialogues.speaker: JEWELL
dialogues.text: All square? Bryant nods, his fondness obvious. But just then -- The elevator stops on 8 and a GUY gets in. Call him JOE NOBODY. The doors close. Down we go, in silence. But -- Joe Nobody grimaces. He KNOWS he recognizes Jewell from somewhere. Just can’t figure out where. It’s bugging him. Jewell and Bryant have experienced this 500 times now. It's always annoying. But they let it go. We can feel Joe Nobody racking his memory. Where have I seen this guy’s face before? But he’s drawing blanks. Elevator stops on the 2nd floor. Joe gets out. Finally. Then, just as the doors start to close, his eyes light up It just came to him. He turns to Jewell, so excited:

dialogues.speaker: JOE NOBODY
dialogues.text: Now I remember! You’re the Olympic bomber. That lands on the faces of Jewell and Bryant -- a sense that this will never end, not really, anyway. Jewell knows that in his soul. As the doors close, we hear...

dialogues.speaker: WATSON
dialogues.text: No, he’s the hero. As he will forever come to his defense. +.-continue the EPILOGUE: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 172 RICHARD JEWELL - 6/20/19 (Full Blue) 115.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: “In 2007, with his suit against the Atlanta Journal Constitution entering its eleventh year, Richard Jewell died, at the age of 44, of heart failure.” “Five months later, the suit was dismissed.” FADE OUT.
